◆ address_needs() [2/2]

npc_action npc::address_needs ( float  danger)

Definition at line 1779 of file npcmove.cpp.

1780{
1781 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1782 // rng because NPCs are not meant to be hypervigilant hawks that notice everything
1783 // and swing into action with alarming alacrity.
1784 // no sometimes they are just looking the other way, sometimes they hestitate.
1785 // ( also we can get huge performance boosts )
1786 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1787 healing_options try_to_fix_me = patient_assessment( *this );
1788 if( try_to_fix_me.any_true() ) {
1789 if( !use_bionic_by_id( bio_nanobots ) ) {
1790 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_me );
1791 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1792 return npc_heal;
1793 }
1794 }
1795 } else {
1796 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_nanobots );
1797 }
1798 if( get_skill_level( skill_firstaid ) > 0 ) {
1799 if( is_player_ally() ) {
1800 healing_options try_to_fix_other = patient_assessment( player_character );
1801 if( try_to_fix_other.any_true() ) {
1802 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_other );
1803 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1804 ai_cache.ally = g->shared_from( player_character );
1805 return npc_heal_player;
1806 }
1807 }
1808 }
1809 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
1810 if( &guy == this || !guy.is_ally( *this ) || guy.posz() != posz() || !sees( guy ) ) {
1811 continue;
1812 }
1813 healing_options try_to_fix_other = patient_assessment( guy );
1814 if( try_to_fix_other.any_true() ) {
1815 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_other );
1816 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1817 ai_cache.ally = g->shared_from( guy );
1818 return npc_heal_player;
1819 }
1820 }
1821 }
1822 }
1823 }
1824
1825 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1826 if( get_perceived_pain() >= 15 ) {
1827 if( !activate_bionic_by_id( bio_painkiller ) && has_painkiller() && !took_painkiller() ) {
1828 return npc_use_painkiller;
1829 }
1830 } else {
1831 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_painkiller );
1832 }
1833 }
1834
1835 if( one_in( 3 ) && can_reload_current() ) {
1836 return npc_reload;
1837 }
1838
1839 item &reloadable = find_reloadable();
1840 if( !reloadable.is_null() ) {
1841 do_reload( reloadable );
1842 return npc_noop;
1843 }
1844
1845 // Extreme thirst or hunger, bypass safety check.
1846 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::dehydrated ||
1847 get_stored_kcal() + stomach.get_calories() < max_stored_kcal() * 0.75 ) {
1848 if( consume_food_from_camp() ) {
1849 return npc_noop;
1850 }
1851 if( consume_food() ) {
1852 return npc_noop;
1853 }
1854 }
1855 //Does the hallucination needs to disappear ?
1856 if( is_hallucination() && player_character.sees( *this ) ) {
1857 if( !player_character.has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) {
1858 die( nullptr );
1859 }
1860 }
1861
1862 if( danger > NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ) {
1863 return npc_undecided;
1864 }
1865
1866 if( one_in( 3 ) && ( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty ||
1867 get_stored_kcal() + stomach.get_calories() < max_stored_kcal() * 0.95 ) ) {
1868 if( consume_food_from_camp() ) {
1869 return npc_noop;
1870 }
1871 if( consume_food() ) {
1872 return npc_noop;
1873 }
1874 }
1875
1876 if( one_in( 3 ) && wants_to_recharge_cbm() && recharge_cbm() ) {
1877 return npc_noop;
1878 }
1879
1880 if( one_in( 3 ) && find_corpse_to_pulp() ) {
1881 if( !do_pulp() ) {
1882 move_to_next();
1883 }
1884 return npc_noop;
1885 }
1886
1887 if( one_in( 3 ) && adjust_worn() ) {
1888 return npc_noop;
1889 }
1890
1891 const auto could_sleep = [&]() {
1892 if( danger <= 0.01 ) {
1893 if( get_fatigue() >= fatigue_levels::tired ) {
1894 return true;
1895 } else if( is_walking_with() && player_character.in_sleep_state() &&
1896 get_fatigue() > ( fatigue_levels::tired / 2 ) ) {
1897 return true;
1898 }
1899 }
1900 return false;
1901 };
1902 // TODO: More risky attempts at sleep when exhausted
1903 if( one_in( 3 ) && could_sleep() ) {
1904 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
1905 // TODO: Make tired NPCs handle sleep offscreen
1906 set_fatigue( 0 );
1907 return npc_undecided;
1908 }
1909
1910 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_sleep ) || get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive ) {
1911 return npc_sleep;
1912 } else if( player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1913 // TODO: "Guard me while I sleep" command
1914 return npc_sleep;
1915 }
1916 }
1917 // TODO: Mutation & trait related needs
1918 // e.g. finding glasses; getting out of sunlight if we're an albino; etc.
1919
1920 return npc_undecided;
1921}

◆ address_player()

npc_action npc::address_player ( )

Definition at line 1923 of file npcmove.cpp.

1924{
1925 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1926 if( ( attitude == NPCATT_TALK ) && sees( player_character ) ) {
1927 if( player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1928 // Leave sleeping characters alone.
1929 return npc_undecided;
1930 }
1931 if( rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) <= 6 ) {
1932 return npc_talk_to_player; // Close enough to talk to you
1933 } else {
1934 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1935 say( "<lets_talk>" );
1936 }
1937 return npc_follow_player;
1938 }
1939 }
1940
1941 if( attitude == NPCATT_MUG && sees( player_character ) ) {
1942 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1943 say( _( "Don't move a <swear> muscle…" ) );
1944 }
1945 return npc_mug_player;
1946 }
1947
1948 if( attitude == NPCATT_WAIT_FOR_LEAVE ) {
1949 patience--;
1950 if( patience <= 0 ) {
1951 patience = 0;
1952 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1953 return npc_noop;
1954 }
1955 return npc_undecided;
1956 }
1957
1958 if( attitude == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ) {
1959 return npc_flee;
1960 }
1961
1962 if( attitude == NPCATT_LEAD ) {
1963 if( rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) >= 12 || !sees( player_character ) ) {
1964 int intense = get_effect_int( effect_catch_up );
1965 if( intense < 10 ) {
1966 say( "<keep_up>" );
1967 add_effect( effect_catch_up, 5_turns );
1968 return npc_pause;
1969 } else {
1970 say( "<im_leaving_you>" );
1971 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
1972 return npc_pause;
1973 }
1974 } else if( has_omt_destination() ) {
1975 return npc_goto_destination;
1976 } else { // At goal. Now, waiting on nearby player
1977 return npc_pause;
1978 }
1979 }
1980 return npc_undecided;
1981}

4590 any_broken = true;

4596 return false;

4599 const body_part_set covered = it.get_covered_body_parts( s );
4600 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
4601 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() <= 0 && covered.test( elem.first->token ) ) {
4602 return true;

4610 continue;
4611 }
4612

4614 const bool needs_change = covers_broken( elem, opposite_side( elem.get_side() ) );
4615 // Try to change side (if it makes sense), or take off.
4616 if( ( needs_change && change_side( elem ) ) || takeoff( elem ) ) {
4617 return true;
4618 }
4619 }
4620 }
4621
4622 return false;

2147 double aim_amount = aim_per_move( weapon, recoil );
2148 while( aim_amount > 0 && recoil > 0 && moves > 0 ) {
2149 moves--;
2150 recoil -= aim_amount;

◆ alt_attack()

bool npc::alt_attack ( )

Definition at line 3489 of file npcmove.cpp.

3490{
3491 if( ( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_grenades ) ) || is_hallucination() ) {
3492 return false;
3493 }
3494
3495 Creature *critter = current_target();
3496 if( critter == nullptr ) {
3497 // This function shouldn't be called...
3498 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() called with no target" );
3499 move_pause();
3500 return false;
3501 }
3502
3503 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
3504
3505 const int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
3506 item *used = nullptr;
3507 // Remember if we have an item that is dangerous to hold
3508 bool used_dangerous = false;
3509
3510 static const std::string danger_string( "NPC_THROW_NOW" );
3511 static const std::string alt_string( "NPC_ALT_ATTACK" );
3512 // TODO: The active bomb with shortest fuse should be thrown first
3513 const auto check_alt_item = [&used, &used_dangerous, dist, this]( item & it ) {
3514 const bool dangerous = it.has_flag( danger_string );
3515 if( !dangerous && used_dangerous ) {
3516 return;
3517 }
3518
3519 // Not alt attack
3520 if( !dangerous && !it.has_flag( alt_string ) ) {
3521 return;
3522 }
3523
3524 // TODO: Non-thrown alt items
3525 if( !dangerous && throw_range( it ) < dist ) {
3526 return;
3527 }
3528
3529 // Low priority items
3530 if( !dangerous && used != nullptr ) {
3531 return;
3532 }
3533
3534 used = &it;
3535 used_dangerous = used_dangerous || dangerous;
3536 };
3537
3538 check_alt_item( weapon );
3539 for( auto &sl : inv.slice() ) {
3540 // TODO: Cached values - an itype slot maybe?
3541 check_alt_item( sl->front() );
3542 }
3543
3544 if( used == nullptr ) {
3545 return false;
3546 }
3547
3548 int weapon_index = get_item_position( used );
3549 if( weapon_index == INT_MIN ) {
3550 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() couldn't find expected item %s", used->tname() );
3551 return false;
3552 }
3553
3554 // Are we going to throw this item?
3555 if( !used->active && used->has_flag( "NPC_ACTIVATE" ) ) {
3556 activate_item( weapon_index );
3557 // Note: intentional lack of return here
3558 // We want to ignore player-centric rules to avoid carrying live explosives
3559 // TODO: Non-grenades
3560 }
3561
3562 // We are throwing it!
3563 int conf = confident_throw_range( *used, critter );
3564 const bool wont_hit = wont_hit_friend( tar, *used, true );
3565 if( dist <= conf && wont_hit ) {
3566 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3567 return true;
3568 }
3569
3570 if( wont_hit ) {
3571 // Within this block, our chosen target is outside of our range
3572 update_path( tar );
3573 move_to_next(); // Move towards the target
3574 }
3575
3576 // Danger of friendly fire
3577 if( !wont_hit && !used_dangerous ) {
3578 // Safe to hold on to, for now
3579 // Maneuver around player
3580 avoid_friendly_fire();
3581 return true;
3582 }
3583
3584 map &here = get_map();
3585 // We need to throw this live (grenade, etc) NOW! Pick another target?
3586 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3587 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3588 const monster *const target_ptr = g->critter_at<monster>( pt );
3589 int newdist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3590 // TODO: Change "newdist >= 2" to "newdist >= safe_distance(used)"
3591 if( newdist <= conf && newdist >= 2 && target_ptr &&
3592 wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3593 // Friendlyfire-safe!
3594 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( *target_ptr );
3595 if( !one_in( 100 ) ) {
3596 // Just to prevent infinite loops...
3597 if( alt_attack() ) {
3598 return true;
3599 }
3600 }
3601 return false;
3602 }
3603 }
3604 }
3605 /* If we have reached THIS point, there's no acceptable monster to throw our
3606 * grenade or whatever at. Since it's about to go off in our hands, better to
3607 * just chuck it as far away as possible--while being friendly-safe.
3608 */
3609 int best_dist = 0;
3610 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3611 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3612 int new_dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3613 if( new_dist > best_dist && wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3614 best_dist = new_dist;
3615 tar = pt;
3616 }
3617 }
3618 }
3619 /* Even if tar.x/tar.y didn't get set by the above loop, throw it anyway. They
3620 * should be equal to the original location of our target, and risking friendly
3621 * fire is better than holding on to a live grenade / whatever.
3622 */
3623 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3624 return true;
3625}

◆ assess_danger()

void npc::assess_danger ( )

Definition at line 359 of file npcmove.cpp.

360{
361 float assessment = 0.0f;
362 float highest_priority = 1.0f;
363 int def_radius = rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_close ) ? follow_distance() : 6;
364
365 // Radius we can attack without moving
366 int max_range;
367 if( confident_range_cache ) {
368 max_range = *confident_range_cache;
369 } else {
370 invalidate_range_cache();
371 max_range = *confident_range_cache;
372 }
373
374 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
375 const bool self_defense_only = rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE ||
376 rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NONE;
377 const bool no_fighting = rules.has_flag( ally_rule::forbid_engage );
378 const bool must_retreat = is_walking_with() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_close ) &&
379 !too_close( pos(), player_character.pos(), follow_distance() );
380
381 if( is_player_ally() ) {
382 if( rules.engagement == combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE ) {
383 def_radius = std::max( 6, max_range );
384 } else if( self_defense_only ) {
385 def_radius = max_range;
386 } else if( no_fighting ) {
387 def_radius = 1;
388 }
389 }
390
391 const auto ok_by_rules = [max_range, def_radius, this, &player_character]( const Creature & c,
392 int dist,
393 int scaled_dist ) {
394 // If we're forbidden to attack, no need to check engagement rules
395 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::forbid_engage ) ) {
396 return false;
397 }
398 switch( rules.engagement ) {
399 case combat_engagement::NONE:
400 return false;
401 case combat_engagement::CLOSE:
402 // Either close to player or close enough that we can reach it and close to us
403 return ( dist <= max_range && scaled_dist <= def_radius * 0.5 ) ||
404 too_close( c.pos(), player_character.pos(), def_radius );
405 case combat_engagement::WEAK:
406 return c.get_hp() <= average_damage_dealt();
407 case combat_engagement::HIT:
408 return c.has_effect( effect_hit_by_player );
409 case combat_engagement::NO_MOVE:
410 return dist <= max_range;
411 case combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE:
412 return dist <= max_range;
413 case combat_engagement::ALL:
414 return true;
415 }
416
417 return true;
418 };
419 std::map<direction, float> cur_threat_map;
420 // start with a decayed version of last turn's map
421 for( direction threat_dir : npc_threat_dir ) {
422 cur_threat_map[ threat_dir ] = 0.25f * ai_cache.threat_map[ threat_dir ];
423 }
424 map &here = get_map();
425 // first, check if we're about to be consumed by fire
426 // TODO: Use the field cache
427 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
428 if( pt == pos() || here.has_flag( TFLAG_FIRE_CONTAINER, pt ) ) {
429 continue;
430 }
431 if( here.get_field( pt, fd_fire ) != nullptr ) {
432 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
433 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), pt )] += 2.0f * ( NPC_DANGER_MAX - dist );
434 if( dist < 3 && !has_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad ) ) {
435 warn_about( "fire_bad", 1_minutes );
436 add_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad, 5_turns );
437 path.clear();
438 }
439 }
440 }
441
442 // find our Character friends and enemies
443 std::vector<weak_ptr_fast<Creature>> hostile_guys;
444 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
445 if( &guy == this ) {
446 continue;
447 }
448
449 if( has_faction_relationship( guy, npc_factions::watch_your_back ) ) {
450 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( guy ) );
451 } else if( attitude_to( guy ) != A_NEUTRAL && sees( guy.pos() ) ) {
452 hostile_guys.emplace_back( g->shared_from( guy ) );
453 }
454 }
455 if( sees( player_character.pos() ) ) {
456 if( is_enemy() ) {
457 hostile_guys.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
458 } else if( is_friendly( player_character ) ) {
459 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
460 }
461 }
462
463 for( const monster &critter : g->all_monsters() ) {
464 auto att = critter.attitude_to( *this );
465 if( att == A_FRIENDLY ) {
466 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( critter ) );
467 continue;
468 }
469 if( att != A_HOSTILE && ( critter.friendly || !is_enemy() ) ) {
470 continue;
471 }
472 if( !sees( critter ) ) {
473 continue;
474 }
475 float critter_threat = evaluate_enemy( critter );
476 // warn and consider the odds for distant enemies
477 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), critter.pos() );
478 if( ( is_enemy() || !critter.friendly ) ) {
479 assessment += critter_threat;
480 if( critter_threat > ( 8.0f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 5 ) ) ) {
481 warn_about( "monster", 10_minutes, critter.type->nname(), dist, critter.pos() );
482 }
483 }
484 if( must_retreat || no_fighting ) {
485 continue;
486 }
487 // ignore targets behind glass even if we can see them
488 if( !clear_shot_reach( pos(), critter.pos(), false ) ) {
489 continue;
490 }
491
492 float scaled_distance = std::max( 1.0f, dist / critter.speed_rating() );
493 float hp_percent = 1.0f - static_cast<float>( critter.get_hp() ) / critter.get_hp_max();
494 float critter_danger = std::max( critter_threat * ( hp_percent * 0.5f + 0.5f ),
495 NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW );
496 ai_cache.total_danger += critter_danger / scaled_distance;
497
498 // don't ignore monsters that are too close or too close to an ally if we can move
499 bool is_too_close = dist <= def_radius;
500 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
501 if( is_too_close || self_defense_only ) {
502 break;
503 }
504 // HACK: Bit of a dirty hack - sometimes shared_from, returns nullptr or bad weak_ptr for
505 // friendly NPC when the NPC is riding a creature - I don't know why.
506 // so this skips the bad weak_ptrs, but this doesn't functionally change the AI Priority
507 // because the horse the NPC is riding is still in the ai_cache.friends vector,
508 // so either one would count as a friendly for this purpose.
509 if( guy.lock() ) {
510 is_too_close |= too_close( critter.pos(), guy.lock()->pos(), def_radius );
511 }
512 }
513 // ignore distant monsters that our rules prevent us from attacking
514 if( !is_too_close && is_player_ally() && !ok_by_rules( critter, dist, scaled_distance ) ) {
515 continue;
516 }
517 // prioritize the biggest, nearest threats, or the biggest threats that are threatening
518 // us or an ally
519 // critter danger is always at least NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW
520 float priority = std::max( critter_danger - 2.0f * ( scaled_distance - 1.0f ),
521 is_too_close ? critter_danger : 0.0f );
522 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), critter.pos() )] += priority;
523 if( priority > highest_priority ) {
524 highest_priority = priority;
525 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( critter );
526 ai_cache.danger = critter_danger;
527 }
528 }
529
530 if( assessment == 0.0 && hostile_guys.empty() ) {
531 ai_cache.danger_assessment = assessment;
532 return;
533 }
534 const auto handle_hostile = [&]( const Character & foe, float foe_threat,
535 const std::string & bogey, const std::string & warning ) {
536 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), foe.pos() );
537 if( foe_threat > ( 8.0f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 5 ) ) ) {
538 warn_about( "monster", 10_minutes, bogey, dist, foe.pos() );
539 }
540
541 int scaled_distance = std::max( 1, ( 100 * dist ) / foe.get_speed() );
542 ai_cache.total_danger += foe_threat / scaled_distance;
543 if( must_retreat || no_fighting ) {
544 return 0.0f;
545 }
546 // ignore targets behind glass even if we can see them
547 if( !clear_shot_reach( pos(), foe.pos(), false ) ) {
548 return 0.0f;
549 }
550 bool is_too_close = dist <= def_radius;
551 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
552 if( self_defense_only ) {
553 break;
554 }
555 is_too_close |= too_close( foe.pos(), guy.lock()->pos(), def_radius );
556 if( is_too_close ) {
557 break;
558 }
559 }
560
561 if( !is_player_ally() || is_too_close || ok_by_rules( foe, dist, scaled_distance ) ) {
562 float priority = std::max( foe_threat - 2.0f * ( scaled_distance - 1 ),
563 is_too_close ? std::max( foe_threat, NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ) :
564 0.0f );
565 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), foe.pos() )] += priority;
566 if( priority > highest_priority ) {
567 warn_about( warning, 1_minutes );
568 highest_priority = priority;
569 ai_cache.danger = foe_threat;
570 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( foe );
571 }
572 }
573 return foe_threat;
574 };
575
576 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : hostile_guys ) {
577 player *foe = dynamic_cast<player *>( guy.lock().get() );
578 if( foe && foe->is_npc() ) {
579 assessment += handle_hostile( *foe, evaluate_enemy( *foe ), "bandit", "kill_npc" );
580 }
581 }
582
583 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
584 player *ally = dynamic_cast<player *>( guy.lock().get() );
585 if( !( ally && ally->is_npc() ) ) {
586 continue;
587 }
588 float guy_threat = evaluate_enemy( *ally );
589 float min_danger = assessment >= NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ? NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW : -10.0f;
590 assessment = std::max( min_danger, assessment - guy_threat * 0.5f );
591 }
592
593 if( sees( player_character.pos() ) ) {
594 // Mod for the player
595 // cap player difficulty at 150
596 float player_diff = evaluate_enemy( player_character );
597 if( is_enemy() ) {
598 assessment += handle_hostile( player_character, player_diff, "maniac", "kill_player" );
599 } else if( is_friendly( player_character ) ) {
600 float min_danger = assessment >= NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ? NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW : -10.0f;
601 assessment = std::max( min_danger, assessment - player_diff * 0.5f );
602 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
603 }
604 }
605 assessment *= 0.1f;
606 if( !has_effect( effect_npc_run_away ) && !has_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad ) ) {
607 float my_diff = evaluate_enemy( *this );
608 if( ( my_diff * 0.5f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 10 ) ) < assessment ) {
609 time_duration run_away_for = 5_turns + 1_turns * rng( 0, 5 );
610 warn_about( "run_away", run_away_for );
611 add_effect( effect_npc_run_away, run_away_for );
612 path.clear();
613 }
614 }
615 // update the threat cache
616 for( size_t i = 0; i < 8; i++ ) {
617 direction threat_dir = npc_threat_dir[i];
618 direction dir_right = npc_threat_dir[( i + 1 ) % 8];
619 direction dir_left = npc_threat_dir[( i + 7 ) % 8 ];
620 ai_cache.threat_map[threat_dir] = cur_threat_map[threat_dir] + 0.1f *
621 ( cur_threat_map[dir_right] + cur_threat_map[dir_left] );
622 }
623 if( assessment <= 2.0f ) {
624 assessment = -10.0f + 5.0f * assessment; // Low danger if no monsters around
625 }
626 ai_cache.danger_assessment = assessment;
627}
rng
units::quantity< V, B > rng(const units::quantity< V, B > &min, const units::quantity< V, B > &max)
Definition: artifact.cpp:32

Definition: map.cpp:2304

◆ avoid_friendly_fire()

void npc::avoid_friendly_fire ( )

Definition at line 2461 of file npcmove.cpp.

2462{
2463 // TODO: To parameter
2464 const tripoint &tar = current_target()->pos();
2465 // Calculate center of weight of friends and move away from that
2466 tripoint center;
2467 for( const auto &fr : ai_cache.friends ) {
2468 if( shared_ptr_fast<Creature> fr_p = fr.lock() ) {
2469 center += fr_p->pos();
2470 }
2471 }
2472
2473 float friend_count = ai_cache.friends.size();
2474 center.x = std::round( center.x / friend_count );
2475 center.y = std::round( center.y / friend_count );
2476 center.z = std::round( center.z / friend_count );
2477
2478 std::vector<tripoint> candidates = closest_points_first( pos(), 1 );
2479 candidates.erase( candidates.begin() );
2480 std::sort( candidates.begin(), candidates.end(),
2481 [&tar, &center]( const tripoint & l, const tripoint & r ) {
2482 return ( rl_dist( l, tar ) - rl_dist( l, center ) ) <
2483 ( rl_dist( r, tar ) - rl_dist( r, center ) );
2484 } );
2485
2486 for( const auto &pt : candidates ) {
2487 if( can_move_to( pt ) ) {
2488 move_to( pt );
2489 return;
2490 }
2491 }
2492
2493 /* If we're still in the function at this point, maneuvering can't help us. So,
2494 * might as well address some needs.
2495 * We pass a <danger> value of NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW + 1 so that we won't start
2496 * eating food (or, god help us, sleeping).
2497 */
2498 npc_action action = address_needs( NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW + 1 );
2499 if( action == npc_undecided ) {
2500 move_pause();
2501 }
2502 execute_action( action );
2503}

◆ can_move_to()

bool npc::can_move_to ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  no_bashing = false 
) const

Definition at line 2204 of file npcmove.cpp.

2205{
2206 map &here = get_map();
2207 // Allow moving into any bashable spots, but penalize them during pathing
2208 // Doors are not passable for hallucinations
2209 return( rl_dist( pos(), p ) <= 1 && here.has_floor( p ) && !g->is_dangerous_tile( p ) &&
2210 ( here.passable( p ) || ( can_open_door( p, !here.is_outside( pos() ) ) && !is_hallucination() ) ||
2211 ( !no_bashing && here.bash_rating( smash_ability(), p ) > 0 ) )
2212 );
2213}

◆ can_read()

bool npc::can_read ( const item &  book,
std::vector< std::string > &  fail_reasons 
)

Definition at line 838 of file npc.cpp.

839{
840 if( !book.is_book() ) {
841 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "This %s is not good reading material." ),
842 book.tname() ) );
843 return false;
844 }
845 player *pl = dynamic_cast<player *>( this );
846 if( !pl ) {
847 return false;
848 }
849 const auto &type = book.type->book;
850 const skill_id &skill = type->skill;
851 const int skill_level = pl->get_skill_level( skill );
852 if( skill && skill_level < type->req ) {
853 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "I'm not smart enough to read this book." ) ) );
854 return false;
855 }
856 if( !skill || skill_level >= type->level ) {
857 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "I won't learn anything from this book." ) ) );
858 return false;
859 }
860
861 // Check for conditions that disqualify us
862 if( type->intel > 0 && has_trait( trait_ILLITERATE ) ) {
863 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "I can't read!" ) );
864 } else if( has_trait( trait_HYPEROPIC ) && !worn_with_flag( "FIX_FARSIGHT" ) &&
865 !has_effect( effect_contacts ) && !has_bionic( bio_eye_optic ) ) {
866 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "I can't read without my glasses." ) );
867 } else if( fine_detail_vision_mod() > 4 ) {
868 // Too dark to read only applies if the player can read to himself
869 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "It's too dark to read!" ) );
870 return false;
871 }
872 return true;
873}

◆ check_or_use_weapon_cbm()

void npc::check_or_use_weapon_cbm ( const bionic_id &  cbm_id)

Definition at line 463 of file bionics.cpp.

464{
465 // if we're already using a bio_weapon, keep using it
466 if( cbm_weapon_index >= 0 ) {
467 return;
468 }
469 const float allowed_ratio = static_cast<int>( rules.cbm_reserve ) / 100.0f;
470 const units::energy free_power = get_power_level() - get_max_power_level() * allowed_ratio;
471 if( free_power <= 0_J ) {
472 return;
473 }
474
475 int index = 0;
476 bool found = false;
477 for( bionic &i : *my_bionics ) {
478 if( i.id == cbm_id && !i.powered ) {
479 found = true;
480 break;
481 }
482 index += 1;
483 }
484 if( !found ) {
485 return;
486 }
487 bionic &bio = ( *my_bionics )[index];
488
489 if( bio.info().has_flag( flag_BIONIC_GUN ) ) {
490 const item cbm_weapon = item( bio.info().fake_item );
491 bool not_allowed = !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) ||
492 ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) && !cbm_weapon.is_silent() );
493 if( is_player_ally() && not_allowed ) {
494 return;
495 }
496
497 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
498 int ammo_count = weapon.ammo_remaining();
499 const int ups_drain = weapon.get_gun_ups_drain();
500 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
501 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
502 }
503 const int cbm_ammo = free_power / bio.info().power_activate;
504
505 if( weapon_value( weapon, ammo_count ) < weapon_value( cbm_weapon, cbm_ammo ) ) {
506 real_weapon = weapon;
507 weapon = cbm_weapon;
508 cbm_weapon_index = index;
509 }
510 } else if( bio.info().has_flag( flag_BIONIC_WEAPON ) && !weapon.has_flag( flag_NO_UNWIELD ) &&
511 free_power > bio.info().power_activate ) {
512 if( is_armed() ) {
513 stow_item( weapon );
514 }
515 if( get_player_character().sees( pos() ) ) {
516 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s activates their %s." ), disp_name(), bio.info().name );
517 }
518
519 weapon = item( bio.info().fake_item );
520 mod_power_level( -bio.info().power_activate );
521 bio.powered = true;
522 cbm_weapon_index = index;
523 }
524}

◆ complain()

bool npc::complain ( )

Definition at line 4462 of file npcmove.cpp.

4463{
4464 static const std::string infected_string = "infected";
4465 static const std::string fatigue_string = "fatigue";
4466 static const std::string bite_string = "bite";
4467 static const std::string bleed_string = "bleed";
4468 static const std::string radiation_string = "radiation";
4469 static const std::string hunger_string = "hunger";
4470 static const std::string thirst_string = "thirst";
4471
4472 if( !is_player_ally() || !get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4473 return false;
4474 }
4475
4476 // When infected, complain every (4-intensity) hours
4477 // At intensity 3, ignore player wanting us to shut up
4478 if( has_effect( effect_infected ) ) {
4479 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_infected );
4480 const auto &eff = get_effect( effect_infected, bp );
4481 int intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4482 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s wound is infected…" ),
4483 body_part_name( bp ) );
4484 if( complain_about( infected_string, time_duration::from_hours( 4 - intensity ), speech,
4485 intensity >= 3 ) ) {
4486 // Only one complaint per turn
4487 return true;
4488 }
4489 }
4490
4491 // When bitten, complain every hour, but respect restrictions
4492 if( has_effect( effect_bite ) ) {
4493 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bite );
4494 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "The bite wound on my %s looks bad." ),
4495 body_part_name( bp ) );
4496 if( complain_about( bite_string, 1_hours, speech ) ) {
4497 return true;
4498 }
4499 }
4500
4501 // When tired, complain every 30 minutes
4502 // If massively tired, ignore restrictions
4503 if( get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::tired &&
4504 complain_about( fatigue_string, 30_minutes, _( "<yawn>" ),
4505 get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive - 100 ) ) {
4506 return true;
4507 }
4508
4509 // Radiation every 10 minutes
4510 if( get_rad() > 90 ) {
4511 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4512 std::string speech = _( "I'm suffering from radiation sickness…" );
4513 if( complain_about( radiation_string, 10_minutes, speech, get_rad() > 150 ) ) {
4514 return true;
4515 }
4516 } else if( !get_rad() ) {
4517 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4518 }
4519
4520 // Hunger every 3-6 hours
4521 // Since NPCs can't starve to death, respect the rules
4522 if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.9 &&
4523 complain_about( hunger_string, std::max( 3_hours,
4524 time_duration::from_minutes( get_kcal_percent() * 60 * 7 ) ), _( "<hungry>" ) ) ) {
4525 return true;
4526 }
4527
4528 // Thirst every 2 hours
4529 // Since NPCs can't dry to death, respect the rules
4530 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::very_thirsty &&
4531 complain_about( thirst_string, 2_hours, _( "<thirsty>" ) ) ) {
4532 return true;
4533 }
4534
4535 //Bleeding every 5 minutes
4536 if( has_effect( effect_bleed ) ) {
4537 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bleed );
4538 std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s is bleeding!" ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4539 if( complain_about( bleed_string, 5_minutes, speech ) ) {
4540 return true;
4541 }
4542 }
4543
4544 return false;
4545}

◆ complain_about()

bool npc::complain_about ( const std::string &  issue,

const std::string &  speech,

)

Definition at line 4431 of file npcmove.cpp.

4433{
4434 // Don't have a default constructor for time_point, so accessing it in the
4435 // complaints map is a bit difficult, those lambdas should cover it.
4436 const auto complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key, const time_duration & d ) {
4437 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4438 return iter == complaints.end() || iter->second < calendar::turn - d;
4439 };
4440 const auto set_complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key ) {
4441 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4442 if( iter == complaints.end() ) {
4443 complaints.emplace( key, calendar::turn );
4444 } else {
4445 iter->second = calendar::turn;
4446 }
4447 };
4448
4449 // Don't wake player up with non-serious complaints
4450 // Stop complaining while asleep
4451 const bool do_complain = force || ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_complain ) &&
4452 !get_player_character().in_sleep_state() && !in_sleep_state() );
4453
4454 if( complain_since( issue, dur ) && do_complain ) {
4455 say( speech, priority );
4456 set_complain_since( issue );
4457 return true;
4458 }
4459 return false;
4460}

2043{
2044 if( !gun || gun.melee() ) {
2045 return 0;
2046 }
2047
2048 // Same calculation as in @ref item::info
2049 // TODO: Extract into common method

bool npc::consume_food ( )

Returns true if food was consumed, false otherwise.

3864{
3865 float best_weight = 0.0f;
3866 int index = -1;
3867 int want_hunger = std::max<int>( 0, ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 );
3868 int want_quench = std::max( 0, get_thirst() );
3869 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3870 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3871 const item &it = slice[i]->front();
3872 if( const item *food_item = it.get_food() ) {
3873 float cur_weight = rate_food( *food_item, want_hunger, want_quench );
3874 // Note: will_eat is expensive, avoid calling it if possible
3875 if( cur_weight > best_weight && will_eat( *food_item ).success() ) {
3876 best_weight = cur_weight;
3877 index = i;
3878 }
3879 }
3880 }
3881
3882 if( index == -1 ) {
3883 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3884 // TODO: Remove this and let player "exploit" hungry NPCs
3885 set_stored_kcal( max_stored_kcal() );
3886 set_thirst( 0 );
3887 }
3888 return false;
3889 }
3890
3891 // consume doesn't return a meaningful answer, we need to compare moves
3892 // TODO: Make player::consume return false if it fails to consume
3893 int old_moves = moves;
3894 item_location loc = item_location( *this, &i_at( index ) );
3895 bool consumed = consume( loc ) && old_moves != moves;
3896 if( !consumed ) {
3897 debugmsg( "%s failed to consume %s", name, i_at( index ).tname() );
3898 }
3899
3900 return consumed;
3901}

◆ decide_needs()

void npc::decide_needs ( )

Definition at line 1483 of file npc.cpp.

1484{
1485 double needrank[num_needs];
1486 for( auto &elem : needrank ) {
1487 elem = 20;
1488 }
1489 if( weapon.is_gun() ) {
1490 int ups_drain = weapon.get_gun_ups_drain();
1491 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
1492 int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS_off, ups_drain ) +
1493 charges_of( itype_UPS_off, ups_drain );
1494 needrank[need_ammo] = static_cast<double>( ups_charges ) / ups_drain;
1495 } else {
1496 needrank[need_ammo] = get_ammo( ammotype( *weapon.type->gun->ammo.begin() ) ).size();
1497 }
1498 needrank[need_ammo] *= 5;
1499 }
1500 if( !base_location ) {
1501 needrank[need_safety] = 1;
1502 }
1503
1504 needrank[need_weapon] = weapon_value( weapon );
1505 needrank[need_food] = 15.0f - ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10.0f;
1506 needrank[need_drink] = 15 - get_thirst();
1507 invslice slice = inv.slice();
1508 for( auto &i : slice ) {
1509 item inventory_item = i->front();
1510 if( const item *food = inventory_item.get_food() ) {
1511 needrank[ need_food ] += nutrition_for( *food ) / 4.0;
1512 needrank[ need_drink ] += food->get_comestible()->quench / 4.0;
1513 }
1514 }
1515 needs.clear();
1516 size_t j;
1517 bool serious = false;
1518 for( int i = 1; i < num_needs; i++ ) {
1519 if( needrank[i] < 10 ) {
1520 serious = true;
1521 }
1522 }
1523 if( !serious ) {
1524 needs.push_back( need_none );
1525 needrank[0] = 10;
1526 }
1527 for( int i = 1; i < num_needs; i++ ) {
1528 if( needrank[i] < 20 ) {
1529 for( j = 0; j < needs.size(); j++ ) {
1530 if( needrank[i] < needrank[needs[j]] ) {
1531 needs.insert( needs.begin() + j, static_cast<npc_need>( i ) );
1532 j = needs.size() + 1;
1533 }
1534 }
1535 if( j == needs.size() ) {
1536 needs.push_back( static_cast<npc_need>( i ) );
1537 }
1538 }
1539 }
1540}

◆ die()

void npc::die ( Creature *  killer)
overridevirtual

Empty function.

Should always be overwritten by the appropriate player/NPC/monster version.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 2440 of file npc.cpp.

2441{
2442 if( dead ) {
2443 // We are already dead, don't die again, note that npc::dead is
2444 // *only* set to true in this function!
2445 return;
2446 }
2447 if( assigned_camp ) {
2448 cata::optional<basecamp *> bcp = overmap_buffer.find_camp( ( *assigned_camp ).xy() );
2449 if( bcp ) {
2450 ( *bcp )->remove_assignee( getID() );
2451 }
2452 }
2453 assigned_camp = cata::nullopt;
2454 // Need to unboard from vehicle before dying, otherwise
2455 // the vehicle code cannot find us
2456 if( in_vehicle ) {
2457 g->m.unboard_vehicle( pos(), true );
2458 }
2459 if( is_mounted() ) {
2460 monster *critter = mounted_creature.get();
2461 critter->remove_effect( effect_ridden );
2462 critter->mounted_player = nullptr;
2463 critter->mounted_player_id = character_id();
2464 }
2465 // if this NPC was the only member of a micro-faction, clean it up.
2466 if( my_fac ) {
2467 if( !is_fake() && !is_hallucination() ) {
2468 if( my_fac->members.size() == 1 ) {
2469 for( auto elem : inv_dump() ) {
2470 elem->remove_owner();
2471 elem->remove_old_owner();
2472 }
2473 }
2474 my_fac->remove_member( getID() );
2475 }
2476 }
2477 dead = true;
2478 Character::die( nkiller );
2479
2480 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2481 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2482 add_msg( _( "%s disappears." ), name.c_str() );
2483 }
2484 return;
2485 }
2486
2487 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2488 add_msg( _( "%s dies!" ), name );
2489 }
2490
2491 if( Character *ch = dynamic_cast<Character *>( killer ) ) {
2492 g->events().send<event_type::character_kills_character>( ch->getID(), getID(), get_name() );
2493 }
2494
2495 if( killer == &g->u && ( !guaranteed_hostile() || hit_by_player ) ) {
2496 bool cannibal = g->u.has_trait( trait_CANNIBAL );
2497 bool psycho = g->u.has_trait( trait_PSYCHOPATH );
2498 if( g->u.has_trait( trait_SAPIOVORE ) || psycho ) {
2499 // No morale effect
2500 } else if( cannibal ) {
2501 g->u.add_morale( MORALE_KILLED_INNOCENT, -5, 0, 2_days, 3_hours );
2502 } else {
2503 g->u.add_morale( MORALE_KILLED_INNOCENT, -100, 0, 2_days, 3_hours );
2504 }
2505 }

◆ do_player_activity()

bool npc::do_player_activity ( )

perform a player activity, returning true if it took up the turn

Definition at line 3329 of file npcmove.cpp.

3330{
3331 int old_moves = moves;
3332 if( moves > 200 && activity && ( activity.is_multi_type() ||
3333 activity.id() == activity_id( "ACT_TIDY_UP" ) ) ) {
3334 // a huge backlog of a multi-activity type can forever loop
3335 // instead; just scan the map ONCE for a task to do, and if it returns false
3336 // then stop scanning, abandon the activity, and kill the backlog of moves.
3337 if( !generic_multi_activity_handler( activity, *this->as_player(), true ) ) {
3338 revert_after_activity();
3339 set_moves( 0 );
3340 return true;
3341 }
3342 }
3343 // the multi-activity types can sometimes cancel the activity, and return without using up any moves.
3344 // ( when they are setting a destination etc. )
3345 // normally this isn't a problem, but in the main game loop, if the NPC has a huge backlog of moves;
3346 // then each of these occurrences will nudge the infinite loop counter up by one.
3347 // ( even if other move-using things occur inbetween )
3348 // so here - if no moves are used in a multi-type activity do_turn(), then subtract a nominal amount
3349 // to satisfy the infinite loop counter.
3350 const bool multi_type = activity ? activity.is_multi_type() : false;
3351 const int moves_before = moves;
3352 while( moves > 0 && activity ) {
3353 activity.do_turn( *this );
3354 if( !is_active() ) {
3355 return true;
3356 }
3357 }
3358 if( multi_type && moves == moves_before ) {
3359 moves -= 1;
3360 }
3361 /* if the activity is finished, grab any backlog or change the mission */
3362 if( !has_destination() && !activity ) {
3363 if( !backlog.empty() ) {
3364 activity = backlog.front();
3365 backlog.pop_front();
3366 current_activity_id = activity.id();
3367 } else {
3368 if( is_player_ally() ) {
3369 add_msg( m_info, string_format( "%s completed the assigned task.", disp_name() ) );
3370 }
3371 current_activity_id = activity_id::NULL_ID();
3372 revert_after_activity();
3373 // if we loaded after being out of the bubble for a while, we might have more
3374 // moves than we need, so clear them
3375 set_moves( 0 );
3376 }
3377 }
3378 return moves != old_moves;
3379}

3121{
3122 /* Remove this when someone debugs it back to functionality */
3123 return;
3124
3125 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is dropping items-%3.2f kg, %3.2f L (%d items, wgt %3.2f/%3.2f kg, "
3126 "vol %3.2f/%3.2f L)",
3127 name, units::to_kilogram( drop_weight ), units::to_liter( drop_volume ), inv.size(),
3128 units::to_kilogram( weight_carried() ), units::to_kilogram( weight_capacity() ),
3129 units::to_liter( volume_carried() ), units::to_liter( volume_capacity() ) );
3130
3131 units::mass weight_dropped = units::from_gram( 0 );
3132 units::volume volume_dropped = units::from_liter( 0 );
3133 std::vector<ratio_index> rWgt, rVol; // Weight/Volume to value ratios
3134
3135 // First fill our ratio vectors, so we know which things to drop first
3136 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3137 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3138 item &it = slice[i]->front();
3139 double wgt_ratio = 0.0;
3140 double vol_ratio = 0.0;
3141 if( value( it ) == 0 || value( it ) <= min_val ) {
3142 wgt_ratio = 99999;
3143 vol_ratio = 99999;
3144 } else {
3145 wgt_ratio = units::to_gram<double>( it.weight() ) / value( it );
3146 vol_ratio = units::to_liter( it.volume() / value( it ) );
3147 }
3148 bool added_wgt = false;
3149 bool added_vol = false;
3150 for( size_t j = 0; j < rWgt.size() && !added_wgt; j++ ) {
3151 if( wgt_ratio > rWgt[j].ratio ) {
3152 added_wgt = true;
3153 rWgt.insert( rWgt.begin() + j, ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3154 }
3155 }
3156 if( !added_wgt ) {
3157 rWgt.push_back( ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3158 }
3159 for( size_t j = 0; j < rVol.size() && !added_vol; j++ ) {
3160 if( vol_ratio > rVol[j].ratio ) {
3161 added_vol = true;
3162 rVol.insert( rVol.begin() + j, ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3163 }
3164 }
3165 if( !added_vol ) {
3166 rVol.push_back( ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3167 }
3168 }
3169
3170 map &here = get_map();
3171 std::string item_name; // For description below
3172 int num_items_dropped = 0; // For description below
3173 // Now, drop items, starting from the top of each list
3174 while( weight_dropped < drop_weight || volume_dropped < drop_volume ) {
3175 // weight and volume may be passed as 0 or a negative value, to indicate that
3176 // decreasing that variable is not important.
3177 int dWeight = units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3178 units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight - weight_dropped ) / 250;
3179 int dVolume = units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3180 units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume - volume_dropped ) / 250;
3181 int index;
3182 // Which is more important, weight or volume?
3183 if( dWeight > dVolume ) {
3184 index = rWgt[0].index;
3185 rWgt.erase( rWgt.begin() );
3186 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3187 for( auto &elem : rWgt ) {
3188 if( elem.index > index ) {
3189 elem.index--;
3190 }
3191 }
3192 } else {
3193 index = rVol[0].index;
3194 rVol.erase( rVol.begin() );
3195 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3196 for( size_t i = 0; i < rVol.size(); i++ ) {
3197 if( i > rVol.size() ) {
3198 debugmsg( "npc::drop_items() - looping through rVol - Size is %d, i is %d",
3199 rVol.size(), i );
3200 }
3201 if( rVol[i].index > index ) {
3202 rVol[i].index--;
3203 }
3204 }
3205 }
3206 weight_dropped += slice[index]->front().weight();
3207 volume_dropped += slice[index]->front().volume();
3208 item dropped = i_rem( index );
3209 num_items_dropped++;
3210 if( num_items_dropped == 1 ) {
3211 item_name += dropped.tname();
3212 } else if( num_items_dropped == 2 ) {
3213 item_name += _( " and " ) + dropped.tname();
3214 }
3215 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't drop real items
3216 here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), dropped );
3217 }
3218 }
3219 // Finally, describe the action if u can see it
3220 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3221 if( num_items_dropped >= 3 ) {
3222 add_msg( vgettext( "%s drops %d item.", "%s drops %d items.", num_items_dropped ), name,
3223 num_items_dropped );
3224 } else {
3225 add_msg( _( "%1$s drops a %2$s." ), name, item_name );
3226 }
3227 }
3228 update_worst_item_value();
3229}

◆ enough_time_to_reload()

bool npc::enough_time_to_reload ( const item &  gun) const

Definition at line 2116 of file npcmove.cpp.

2117{
2118 int rltime = item_reload_cost( gun, item( gun.ammo_default() ),
2119 gun.ammo_capacity() );
2120 const float turns_til_reloaded = static_cast<float>( rltime ) / get_speed();
2121
2122 const Creature *target = current_target();
2123 if( target == nullptr ) {
2124 // No target, plenty of time to reload
2125 return true;
2126 }
2127
2128 const auto distance = rl_dist( pos(), target->pos() );
2129 const float target_speed = target->speed_rating();
2130 const float turns_til_reached = distance / target_speed;
2131 if( target->is_player() || target->is_npc() ) {
2132 auto &c = dynamic_cast<const Character &>( *target );
2133 // TODO: Allow reloading if the player has a low accuracy gun
2134 if( sees( c ) && c.weapon.is_gun() && rltime > 200 &&
2135 c.weapon.gun_range( true ) > distance + turns_til_reloaded / target_speed ) {
2136 // Don't take longer than 2 turns if player has a gun
2137 return false;
2138 }
2139 }
2140
2141 // TODO: Handle monsters with ranged attacks and players with CBMs
2142 return turns_til_reloaded < turns_til_reached;
2143}

◆ evaluate_enemy()

float npc::evaluate_enemy ( const Creature &  target) const

rates how dangerous a target is from 0 (harmless) to 1 (max danger)

341{
342 if( target.is_monster() ) {
343 const monster &mon = dynamic_cast<const monster &>( target );

◆ execute_action()

void npc::execute_action ( npc_action  action)

Definition at line 952 of file npcmove.cpp.

953{
954 int oldmoves = moves;
955 tripoint tar = pos();
956 Creature *cur = current_target();
957 if( action == npc_flee ) {
958 tar = good_escape_direction( false );
959 } else if( cur != nullptr ) {
960 tar = cur->pos();
961 }
962 /*
963 debugmsg("%s ran execute_action() with target = %d! Action %s",
964 name, target, npc_action_name(action));
965 */
966
967 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
968 map &here = get_map();
969 switch( action ) {
970 case npc_pause:
971 move_pause();
972 break;
973 case npc_worker_downtime:
974 worker_downtime();
975 break;
976 case npc_reload: {
977 do_reload( weapon );
978 }
979 break;
980
981 case npc_investigate_sound: {
982 tripoint cur_pos = pos();
983 update_path( here.getlocal( ai_cache.s_abs_pos ) );
984 move_to_next();
985 if( pos() == cur_pos ) {
986 ai_cache.stuck += 1;
987 }
988 }
989 break;
990
991 case npc_return_to_guard_pos: {
992 const tripoint local_guard_pos = here.getlocal( *ai_cache.guard_pos );
993 update_path( local_guard_pos );
994 if( pos() == local_guard_pos || path.empty() ) {
995 move_pause();
996 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
997 path.clear();
998 } else {
999 move_to_next();
1000 }
1001 }
1002 break;
1003
1004 case npc_sleep: {
1005 // TODO: Allow stims when not too tired
1006 // Find a nice spot to sleep
1007 int best_sleepy = sleep_spot( pos() );
1008 tripoint best_spot = pos();
1009 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), 6 ) ) {
1010 if( !could_move_onto( p ) || !g->is_empty( p ) ) {
1011 continue;
1012 }
1013
1014 // TODO: Blankets when it's cold
1015 const int sleepy = sleep_spot( p );
1016 if( sleepy > best_sleepy ) {
1017 best_sleepy = sleepy;
1018 best_spot = p;
1019 }
1020 }
1021 if( is_walking_with() ) {
1022 complain_about( "napping", 30_minutes, _( "<warn_sleep>" ) );
1023 }
1024 update_path( best_spot );
1025 // TODO: Handle empty path better
1026 if( best_spot == pos() || path.empty() ) {
1027 move_pause();
1028 if( !has_effect( effect_lying_down ) ) {
1029 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_soporific );
1030 add_effect( effect_lying_down, 30_minutes, num_bp, 1 );
1031 if( player_character.sees( *this ) && !player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1032 add_msg( _( "%s lies down to sleep." ), name );
1033 }
1034 }
1035 } else {
1036 move_to_next();
1037 }
1038 }
1039 break;
1040
1041 case npc_pickup:
1042 pick_up_item();
1043 break;
1044
1045 case npc_heal:
1046 heal_self();
1047 break;
1048
1049 case npc_use_painkiller:
1050 use_painkiller();
1051 break;
1052
1053 case npc_drop_items:
1054 /* NPCs can't choose this action anymore, but at least it works */
1055 drop_invalid_inventory();
1056 /* drop_items is still broken
1057 * drop_items( weight_carried() - weight_capacity(),
1058 * volume_carried() - volume_capacity() );
1059 */
1060 move_pause();
1061 break;
1062
1063 case npc_flee:
1064 if( path.empty() ) {
1065 move_to( tar );
1066 } else {
1067 move_to_next();
1068 }
1069 break;
1070
1071 case npc_reach_attack:
1072 if( can_use_offensive_cbm() ) {
1073 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_hydraulics );
1074 }
1075 reach_attack( tar );
1076 break;
1077 case npc_melee:
1078 update_path( tar );
1079 if( path.size() > 1 ) {
1080 move_to_next();
1081 } else if( path.size() == 1 ) {
1082 if( cur != nullptr ) {
1083 if( can_use_offensive_cbm() ) {
1084 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_hydraulics );
1085 }
1086 melee_attack( *cur, true );
1087 }
1088 } else {
1089 look_for_player( player_character );
1090 }
1091 break;
1092
1093 case npc_aim:
1094 aim();
1095 break;
1096
1097 case npc_shoot: {
1098 auto mode = weapon.gun_current_mode();
1099 if( !mode ) {
1100 debugmsg( "NPC tried to shoot without valid mode" );
1101 break;
1102 }
1103 aim();
1104 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1105 pretend_fire( this, mode.qty, *mode );
1106 } else {
1107 fire_gun( tar, mode.qty, *mode );
1108 // "discard" the fake bio weapon after shooting it
1109 if( cbm_weapon_index >= 0 ) {
1110 discharge_cbm_weapon();
1111 }
1112 }
1113 break;
1114 }
1115
1116 case npc_look_for_player:
1117 if( saw_player_recently() && last_player_seen_pos && sees( *last_player_seen_pos ) ) {
1118 update_path( *last_player_seen_pos );
1119 move_to_next();
1120 } else {
1121 look_for_player( player_character );
1122 }
1123 break;
1124
1125 case npc_heal_player: {
1126 player *patient = dynamic_cast<player *>( current_ally() );
1127 if( patient ) {
1128 update_path( patient->pos() );
1129 if( path.size() == 1 ) { // We're adjacent to u, and thus can heal u
1130 heal_player( *patient );
1131 } else if( !path.empty() ) {
1132 say( _( "Hold still %s, I'm coming to help you." ), patient->disp_name() );
1133 move_to_next();
1134 } else {
1135 move_pause();
1136 }
1137 }
1138 break;
1139 }
1140 case npc_follow_player:
1141 update_path( player_character.pos() );
1142 if( static_cast<int>( path.size() ) <= follow_distance() &&
1143 player_character.posz() == posz() ) { // We're close enough to u.
1144 move_pause();
1145 } else if( !path.empty() ) {
1146 move_to_next();
1147 } else {
1148 move_pause();
1149 }
1150 // TODO: Make it only happen when it's safe
1151 complain();
1152 break;
1153
1154 case npc_follow_embarked: {
1155 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( player_character.pos() );
1156
1157 if( !vp ) {
1158 debugmsg( "Following an embarked player with no vehicle at their location?" );
1159 // TODO: change to wait? - for now pause
1160 move_pause();
1161 break;
1162 }
1163 vehicle *const veh = &vp->vehicle();
1164
1165 // Try to find the last destination
1166 // This is mount point, not actual position
1167 point last_dest( INT_MIN, INT_MIN );
1168 if( !path.empty() && veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( path[path.size() - 1] ) ) == veh ) {
1169 last_dest = vp->mount();
1170 }
1171
1172 // Prioritize last found path, then seats
1173 // Don't change spots if ours is nice
1174 int my_spot = -1;
1175 std::vector<std::pair<int, int> > seats;
1176 for( const vpart_reference &vp : veh->get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
1177 const player *passenger = veh->get_passenger( vp.part_index() );
1178 if( passenger != this && passenger != nullptr ) {
1179 continue;
1180 }
1181
1182 // a seat is available if either unassigned or assigned to us
1183 auto available_seat = [&]( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
1184 if( !pt.is_seat() ) {
1185 return false;
1186 }
1187 const npc *who = pt.crew();
1188 return !who || who->getID() == getID();
1189 };
1190
1191 const vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
1192
1193 int priority = 0;
1194
1195 if( vp.mount() == last_dest ) {
1196 // Shares mount point with last known path
1197 // We probably wanted to go there in the last turn
1198 priority = 4;
1199
1200 } else if( available_seat( pt ) ) {
1201 // Assuming player "owns" a sensible vehicle seats should be in good spots to occupy
1202 // Prefer our assigned seat if we have one
1203 const npc *who = pt.crew();
1204 priority = who && who->getID() == getID() ? 3 : 2;
1205
1206 } else if( vp.is_inside() ) {
1207 priority = 1;
1208 }
1209
1210 if( passenger == this ) {
1211 my_spot = priority;
1212 }
1213
1214 seats.push_back( std::make_pair( priority, static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) ) );
1215 }
1216
1217 if( my_spot >= 3 ) {
1218 // We won't get any better, so don't try
1219 move_pause();
1220 break;
1221 }
1222
1223 std::sort( seats.begin(), seats.end(),
1224 []( const std::pair<int, int> &l, const std::pair<int, int> &r ) {
1225 return l.first > r.first;
1226 } );
1227
1228 if( seats.empty() ) {
1229 // TODO: be angry at player, switch to wait or leave - for now pause
1230 move_pause();
1231 break;
1232 }
1233
1234 // Only check few best seats - pathfinding can get expensive
1235 const size_t try_max = std::min<size_t>( 4, seats.size() );
1236 for( size_t i = 0; i < try_max; i++ ) {
1237 if( seats[i].first <= my_spot ) {
1238 // We have a nicer spot than this
1239 // Note: this will make NPCs steal player's seat...
1240 break;
1241 }
1242
1243 const int cur_part = seats[i].second;
1244
1245 tripoint pp = veh->global_part_pos3( cur_part );
1246 update_path( pp, true );
1247 if( !path.empty() ) {
1248 // All is fine
1249 move_to_next();
1250 break;
1251 }
1252 }
1253
1254 // TODO: Check the rest
1255 move_pause();
1256 }
1257
1258 break;
1259 case npc_talk_to_player:
1260 talk_to_u();
1261 moves = 0;
1262 break;
1263
1264 case npc_mug_player:
1265 mug_player( player_character );
1266 break;
1267
1268 case npc_goto_destination:
1269 go_to_omt_destination();
1270 break;
1271
1272 case npc_avoid_friendly_fire:
1273 avoid_friendly_fire();
1274 break;
1275
1276 case npc_escape_explosion:
1277 escape_explosion();
1278 break;
1279
1280 case npc_player_activity:
1281 do_player_activity();
1282 break;
1283
1284 case npc_undecided:
1285 complain();
1286 move_pause();
1287 break;
1288
1289 case npc_noop:
1290 add_msg( m_debug, "%s skips turn (noop)", disp_name() );
1291 return;
1292
1293 default:
1294 debugmsg( "Unknown NPC action (%d)", action );
1295 }
1296
1297 if( oldmoves == moves ) {
1298 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC didn't use its moves. Action %s (%d).",
1299 npc_action_name( action ), action );
1300 }
1301}

3232{
3233 Character &player_character = get_player_character();

3235 player_character.in_vehicle ) ) ||
3236 is_hallucination() ) {
3237 return false;
3238 }
3239
3240 map &here = get_map();
3241 // Pathing with overdraw can get expensive, limit it
3242 int path_counter = 4;
3243 const auto check_tile = [this, &path_counter, &here]( const tripoint & p ) -> const item * {
3244 if( !here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) || !sees( p ) )
3245 {
3246 return nullptr;
3247 }
3248
3249 const map_stack items = here.i_at( p );
3250 const item *found = nullptr;
3251 for( const item &it : items )
3252 {
3253 // Pulp only stuff that revives, but don't pulp acid stuff
3254 // That is, if you aren't protected from this stuff!
3255 if( it.can_revive() ) {
3256 // If the first encountered corpse bleeds something dangerous then
3257 // it is not safe to bash.
3258 if( is_dangerous_field( field_entry( it.get_mtype()->bloodType(), 1, 0_turns ) ) ) {
3259 return nullptr;
3260 }
3261
3262 found = &it;
3263 break;
3264 }
3265 }
3266
3267 if( found != nullptr )
3268 {
3269 path_counter--;
3270 // Only return corpses we can path to
3271 return update_path( p, false, false ) ? found : nullptr;
3272 }
3273
3274 return nullptr;
3275 };
3276
3277 const int range = 6;
3278
3279 const item *corpse = nullptr;
3280 if( pulp_location && square_dist( pos(), *pulp_location ) <= range ) {
3281 corpse = check_tile( *pulp_location );
3282 }
3283
3284 // Find the old target to avoid spamming
3285 const item *old_target = corpse;
3286
3287 if( corpse == nullptr ) {
3288 // If we're following the player, don't wander off to pulp corpses
3289 const tripoint &around = is_walking_with() ? player_character.pos() : pos();

3291 special_item_type::corpse ) ) {
3292 corpse = check_tile( location.position() );
3293
3294 if( corpse != nullptr ) {
3295 pulp_location.emplace( location.position() );
3296 break;
3297 }
3298
3299 if( path_counter <= 0 ) {
3300 break;
3301 }
3302 }
3303 }
3304
3305 if( corpse != nullptr && corpse != old_target && is_walking_with() ) {
3306 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pulp that %s." ), corpse->tname() );
3307 }
3308
3309 return corpse != nullptr;
3310}

◆ find_dangerous_explosives()

std::vector< sphere > npc::find_dangerous_explosives ( ) const
private

Definition at line 307 of file npcmove.cpp.

308{
309 std::vector<sphere> result;
310
311 const auto active_items = get_map().get_active_items_in_radius( pos(), MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE,
312 special_item_type::explosive );
313
314 for( const auto &elem : active_items ) {
315 const auto use = elem->type->get_use( "explosion" );
316
317 if( !use ) {
318 continue;
319 }
320
321 const explosion_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const explosion_iuse *>( use->get_actor_ptr() );
322 const int safe_range = actor->explosion.safe_range();
323
324 if( rl_dist( pos(), elem.position() ) >= safe_range ) {
325 continue; // Far enough.
326 }
327
328 const int turns_to_evacuate = 2 * safe_range / speed_rating();
329
330 if( elem->charges > turns_to_evacuate ) {
331 continue; // Consider only imminent dangers.
332 }
333
334 result.emplace_back( elem.position(), safe_range );
335 }
336
337 return result;
338}

2789 const int range = 6;
2790 //int range = sight_range( g->light_level( posz() ) );
2791 //range = std::max( 1, std::min( 12, range ) );
2792
2793 static const zone_type_id zone_type_no_npc_pickup( "NO_NPC_PICKUP" );
2794
2795 const item *wanted = nullptr;
2796
2797 const bool whitelisting = has_item_whitelist();
2798
2799 if( volume_allowed <= 0_ml || weight_allowed <= 0_gram ) {
2800 return;
2801 }
2802
2803 const auto consider_item =
2804 [&wanted, &best_value, whitelisting, volume_allowed, weight_allowed, this]
2805 ( const item & it, const tripoint & p ) {
2806 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
2807 // Don't even consider liquids.
2808 return;
2809 }
2810 std::vector<npc *> followers;
2811 for( auto &elem : g->get_follower_list() ) {
2812 shared_ptr_fast<npc> npc_to_get = overmap_buffer.find_npc( elem );
2813 if( !npc_to_get ) {
2814 continue;
2815 }
2816 npc *npc_to_add = npc_to_get.get();
2817 followers.push_back( npc_to_add );
2818 }
2819 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
2820 for( auto &elem : followers ) {
2821 if( !it.is_owned_by( *this, true ) && ( player_character.sees( this->pos() ) ||
2822 player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos ) ||
2823 elem->sees( this->pos() ) || elem->sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2824 return;
2825 }
2826 }
2827 if( whitelisting && !item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
2828 return;
2829 }
2830
2831 // When using a whitelist, skip the value check
2832 // TODO: Whitelist hierarchy?
2833 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : value( it );
2834
2835 if( itval > best_value &&
2836 ( it.volume() <= volume_allowed && it.weight() <= weight_allowed ) ) {
2837 wanted_item_pos = p;
2838 wanted = &( it );
2839 best_value = itval;
2840 }
2841 };
2842
2843 map &here = get_map();
2844 // Harvest item doesn't exist, so we'll be checking by its name
2845 std::string wanted_name;
2846 const auto consider_terrain =
2847 [ this, whitelisting, volume_allowed, &wanted, &wanted_name, &here ]( const tripoint & p ) {
2848 // We only want to pick plants when there are no items to pick
2849 if( !whitelisting || wanted != nullptr || !wanted_name.empty() || volume_allowed < 250_ml ) {
2850 return;
2851 }
2852
2853 const auto &harvest = here.get_harvest_names( p );
2854 for( const auto &entry : harvest ) {
2855 if( item_name_whitelisted( entry ) ) {
2856 wanted_name = entry;
2857 wanted_item_pos = p;
2858 break;
2859 }
2860 }
2861 };
2862
2863 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), range ) ) {
2864 // TODO: Make this sight check not overdraw nearby tiles
2865 // TODO: Optimize that zone check
2866 if( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_no_npc_pickup, p ) ) {
2867 continue;
2868 }
2869
2870 const tripoint abs_p = global_square_location() - pos() + p;
2871 const int prev_num_items = ai_cache.searched_tiles.get( abs_p, -1 );
2872 // Prefetch the number of items present so we can bail out if we already checked here.
2873 const map_stack m_stack = here.i_at( p );
2874 int num_items = m_stack.size();
2875 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2876 if( vp ) {
2877 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2878 if( cargo ) {
2879 vehicle_stack v_stack = cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() );
2880 num_items += v_stack.size();
2881 }
2882 }
2883 if( prev_num_items == num_items ) {
2884 continue;
2885 }
2886 auto cache_tile = [this, &abs_p, num_items, &wanted]() {
2887 if( wanted == nullptr ) {
2888 ai_cache.searched_tiles.insert( 1000, abs_p, num_items );
2889 }
2890 };
2891 bool can_see = false;
2892 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2893 can_see = true;
2894 for( const item &it : m_stack ) {
2895 consider_item( it, p );
2896 }
2897 }
2898
2899 // Not cached because it gets checked once and isn't expected to change.
2900 if( can_see || sees( p ) ) {
2901 can_see = true;
2902 consider_terrain( p );
2903 }
2904
2905 if( !vp || vp->vehicle().is_moving() || !( can_see || sees( p ) ) ) {
2906 cache_tile();
2907 continue;
2908 }
2909 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2910 static const std::string locked_string( "LOCKED" );
2911 // TODO: Let player know what parts are safe from NPC thieves
2912 if( !cargo || cargo->has_feature( locked_string ) ) {
2913 cache_tile();
2914 continue;
2915 }
2916
2917 static const std::string cargo_locking_string( "CARGO_LOCKING" );
2918 if( vp.part_with_feature( cargo_locking_string, true ) ) {
2919 cache_tile();
2920 continue;
2921 }
2922
2923 for( const item &it : cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() ) ) {
2924 consider_item( it, p );
2925 }
2926 cache_tile();
2927 }
2928
2929 if( wanted != nullptr ) {
2930 wanted_name = wanted->tname();
2931 }
2932
2933 if( wanted_name.empty() ) {
2934 return;
2935 }
2936
2937 fetching_item = true;
2938
2939 // TODO: Move that check above, make it multi-target pathing and use it
2940 // to limit tiles available for choice of items
2941 const int dist_to_item = rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() );
2942 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2943 update_path( *dest );
2944 }
2945
2946 if( path.empty() && dist_to_item > 1 ) {
2947 // Item not reachable, let's just totally give up for now
2948 fetching_item = false;
2949 }
2950
2951 if( fetching_item && rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) > 1 && is_walking_with() ) {
2952 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pick up that %s." ), wanted_name );
2953 }
2954}
item_stack::size
size_t size() const
Definition: item_stack.cpp:10
map::get_harvest_names
const std::set< std::string > & get_harvest_names(const tripoint &p) const
Returns names of the items that would be dropped.
Definition: map.cpp:1595

Definition: npctalk.cpp:3454

Definition: npctalk.cpp:3434

Definition: npctalk.cpp:3429

Definition: npc.cpp:1717

◆ finish_read()

void npc::finish_read ( item_location  loc)
Intelligence increases reading comprehension

Definition at line 894 of file npc.cpp.

895{
896 if( !loc ) {
897 revert_after_activity();
898 return;
899 }
900
901 item &book = *loc;
902 const auto &reading = book.type->book;
903 if( !reading ) {
904 revert_after_activity();
905 return;
906 }
907 const skill_id &skill = reading->skill;
908 // NPCs don't need to identify the book or learn recipes yet.
909 // NPCs don't read to other NPCs yet.
910 const bool display_messages = my_fac->id == faction_id( "your_followers" ) && g->u.sees( pos() );
911 bool continuous = false; //whether to continue reading or not
912
913 if( book_fun_for( book, *this ) != 0 ) {
914 //Fun bonus is no longer calculated here.
915 add_morale( MORALE_BOOK, book_fun_for( book, *this ) * 5, book_fun_for( book,
916 *this ) * 15, 1_hours, 30_minutes, true,
917 book.type );
918 }
919
920 book.mark_chapter_as_read( *this );
921
922 if( skill && get_skill_level( skill ) < reading->level &&
923 get_skill_level_object( skill ).can_train() ) {
924 SkillLevel &skill_level = get_skill_level_object( skill );
925 const int originalSkillLevel = skill_level.level();
926
927 // Calculate experience gained
928 /** @EFFECT_INT increases reading comprehension */
929 // Enhanced Memory Banks modestly boosts experience
930 int min_ex = std::max( 1, reading->time / 10 + get_int() / 4 );
931 int max_ex = reading->time / 5 + get_int() / 2 - originalSkillLevel;
932 if( has_active_bionic( bio_memory ) ) {
933 min_ex += 2;
934 }
935 if( max_ex < 2 ) {
936 max_ex = 2;
937 }
938 if( max_ex > 10 ) {
939 max_ex = 10;
940 }
941 if( max_ex < min_ex ) {
942 max_ex = min_ex;
943 }
944 const std::string &s = activity.get_str_value( 0, "1" );
945 double penalty = strtod( s.c_str(), nullptr );
946 min_ex *= ( originalSkillLevel + 1 ) * penalty;
947 min_ex = std::max( min_ex, 1 );
948 max_ex *= ( originalSkillLevel + 1 ) * penalty;
949 max_ex = std::max( min_ex, max_ex );
950
951 skill_level.readBook( min_ex, max_ex, reading->level );
952
953 std::string skill_name = skill.obj().name();
954
955 if( skill_level != originalSkillLevel ) {
956 g->events().send<event_type::gains_skill_level>( getID(), skill, skill_level.level() );
957 if( display_messages ) {
958 add_msg( m_good, _( "%s increases their %s level." ), disp_name(), skill_name );
959 // NPC reads until they gain a level, then stop.
960 revert_after_activity();
961 return;
962 }
963 } else {
964 continuous = true;
965 if( display_messages ) {
966 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s learns a little about %s!" ), disp_name(), skill.obj().name() );
967 }
968 }
969
970 if( ( skill_level == reading->level || !skill_level.can_train() ) ||
971 ( ( has_trait( trait_SCHIZOPHRENIC ) ||
972 has_artifact_with( AEP_SCHIZO ) ) && one_in( 25 ) ) ) {
973 if( display_messages ) {
974 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s can no longer learn from %s." ), disp_name(), book.type_name() );
975 }
976 }
977 } else if( skill ) {
978 if( display_messages ) {
979 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s can no longer learn from %s." ), disp_name(), book.type_name() );
980 }
981 }
982
983 // NPCs can't learn martial arts from manuals (yet)
984
985 if( continuous ) {
986 activity.set_to_null();
987 player *pl = dynamic_cast<player *>( this );
988 if( pl ) {
989 start_read( loc, pl );
990 }
991 if( activity ) {
992 return;
993 }
994 }
995 activity.set_to_null();
996 revert_after_activity();
997}

◆ follow_distance()

int npc::follow_distance ( ) const

2198{
2199 // HACK: If the player is standing on stairs, follow closely
2200 // This makes the stair hack less painful to use
2201 if( is_walking_with() &&
2202 ( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, g->u.pos() ) ||
2203 g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, g->u.pos() ) ) ) {
2204 return 1;
2205 }
2206 // Uses ally_rule follow_distance_2 to determine if should follow by 2 or 4 tiles
2207 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_distance_2 ) ) {
2208 return 2;
2209 }

2211 if( !sees( g->u ) ) {
2212 return 2;
2213 }
2214 return 4;
2215}

◆ form_opinion()

void npc::form_opinion ( const player &  u)
Strength increases NPC fear of the player

Definition at line 1210 of file npc.cpp.

1211{
1212 // FEAR
1213 if( u.weapon.is_gun() ) {
1214 // TODO: Make bows not guns
1215 if( weapon.is_gun() ) {
1216 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1217 } else {
1218 op_of_u.fear += 6;
1219 }
1220 } else if( u.weapon_value( u.weapon ) > 20 ) {
1221 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1222 } else if( !u.is_armed() ) {
1223 // Unarmed, but actually unarmed ("unarmed weapons" are not unarmed)
1224 op_of_u.fear -= 3;
1225 }
1226
1227 ///\EFFECT_STR increases NPC fear of the player
1228 if( u.str_max >= 16 ) {
1229 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1230 } else if( u.str_max >= 12 ) {
1231 op_of_u.fear += 1;
1232 } else if( u.str_max <= 3 ) {
1233 op_of_u.fear -= 3;
1234 } else if( u.str_max <= 5 ) {
1235 op_of_u.fear -= 1;
1236 }
1237
1238 // is your health low
1239 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_player_character().get_body() ) {
1240 const int hp_max = elem.second.get_hp_max();
1241 const int hp_cur = elem.second.get_hp_cur();
1242 if( hp_cur <= hp_max / 2 ) {
1243 op_of_u.fear--;
1244 }
1245 }
1246
1247 // is my health low
1248 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
1249 const int hp_max = elem.second.get_hp_max();
1250 const int hp_cur = elem.second.get_hp_cur();
1251 if( hp_cur <= hp_max / 2 ) {
1252 op_of_u.fear++;
1253 }
1254 }
1255
1256 if( u.has_trait( trait_SAPIOVORE ) ) {
1257 op_of_u.fear += 10; // Sapiovores = Scary
1258 }
1259 if( u.has_trait( trait_TERRIFYING ) ) {
1260 op_of_u.fear += 6;
1261 }
1262
1263 int u_ugly = 0;
1264 for( trait_id &mut : u.get_mutations() ) {
1265 u_ugly += mut.obj().ugliness;
1266 }
1267 op_of_u.fear += u_ugly / 2;
1268 op_of_u.trust -= u_ugly / 3;
1269
1270 if( u.get_stim() > 20 ) {
1271 op_of_u.fear++;
1272 }
1273
1274 if( u.has_effect( effect_drunk ) ) {
1275 op_of_u.fear -= 2;
1276 }
1277
1278 // TRUST
1279 if( op_of_u.fear > 0 ) {
1280 op_of_u.trust -= 3;
1281 } else {
1282 op_of_u.trust += 1;
1283 }
1284
1285 if( u.weapon.is_gun() ) {
1286 op_of_u.trust -= 2;
1287 } else if( !u.is_armed() ) {
1288 op_of_u.trust += 2;
1289 }
1290
1291 // TODO: More effects
1292 if( u.has_effect( effect_drunk ) ) {
1293 op_of_u.trust -= 2;
1294 }
1295 if( u.get_stim() > 20 || u.get_stim() < -20 ) {
1296 op_of_u.trust -= 1;
1297 }
1298 if( u.get_painkiller() > 30 ) {
1299 op_of_u.trust -= 1;
1300 }
1301
1302 if( op_of_u.trust > 0 ) {
1303 // Trust is worth a lot right now
1304 op_of_u.trust /= 2;
1305 }
1306
1307 // VALUE
1308 op_of_u.value = 0;
1309 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
1310 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() < elem.second.get_hp_max() * 0.8f ) {
1311 op_of_u.value++;
1312 }
1313 }
1314 decide_needs();
1315 for( const npc_need &i : needs ) {
1316 if( i == need_food || i == need_drink ) {
1317 op_of_u.value += 2;
1318 }
1319 }
1320
1321 if( op_of_u.fear < personality.bravery + 10 &&
1322 op_of_u.fear - personality.aggression > -10 && op_of_u.trust > -8 ) {
1323 set_attitude( NPCATT_TALK );
1324 } else if( op_of_u.fear - 2 * personality.aggression - personality.bravery < -30 ) {
1325 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1326 } else if( my_fac && my_fac->likes_u < -10 ) {
1327 if( is_player_ally() ) {
1328 mutiny();
1329 }
1330 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1331 } else {
1332 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
1333 }
1334
1335 add_msg( m_debug, "%s formed an opinion of u: %s", name, npc_attitude_id( attitude ) );
1336}

◆ get_pathfinding_settings() [2/2]

const pathfinding_settings & npc::get_pathfinding_settings ( bool  no_bashing) const

2911{
2912 path_settings->bash_strength = no_bashing ? 0 : smash_ability();
2913 // TODO: Extract climb skill
2914 const int climb = std::min( 20, get_dex() );
2915 if( climb > 1 ) {
2916 // Success is !one_in(dex), so 0%, 50%, 66%, 75%...
2917 // Penalty for failure chance is 1/success = 1/(1-failure) = 1/(1-(1/dex)) = dex/(dex-1)
2918 path_settings->climb_cost = ( 10 - climb / 5 ) * climb / ( climb - 1 );
2919 } else {
2920 // Climbing at this dexterity will always fail
2921 path_settings->climb_cost = 0;
2922 }
2923
2924 return *path_settings;
2925}

◆ global_square_location()

tripoint npc::global_square_location ( ) const
overridevirtual

Global position, expressed in map square coordinate system (the most detailed coordinate system), used by the map.

The (global) position of an NPC is always: point( submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx() % SEEX, submap_coords.y * SEEY + posy() % SEEY, pos.z) (Expressed in map squares, the system that map uses.) Any of om, map, pos can be in any range. For active NPCs pos would be in the valid range required by the map. But pos, map, and om can be changed without the NPC actual moving as long as the position stays the same: pos() += SEEX; submap_coords.x -= 1; This does not change the global position of the NPC.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 738 of file npc.cpp.

739{
740 return sm_to_ms_copy( submap_coords ) + tripoint( posx() % SEEX, posy() % SEEY, position.z );
741}
Character::posx
int posx() const override
Definition: character.h:838
Character::posy
int posy() const override
Definition: character.h:841
sm_to_ms_copy
point sm_to_ms_copy(const point &p)
Definition: coordinate_conversions.cpp:146
SEEY
static constexpr int SEEY
Definition: game_constants.h:37

References Character::position, Character::posx(), Character::posy(), SEEX, SEEY, sm_to_ms_copy(), submap_coords, and tripoint::z.

Referenced by talk_function::basecamp_mission(), find_item(), good_escape_direction(), and map::rotate().

◆ go_to_omt_destination()

void npc::go_to_omt_destination ( )

Definition at line 4181 of file npcmove.cpp.

4182{
4183 map &here = get_map();
4184 if( ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4185 if( here.getabs( pos() ) == *ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4186 path.clear();
4187 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
4188 move_pause();
4189 return;
4190 }
4191 }
4192 if( goal == no_goal_point || omt_path.empty() ) {
4193 add_msg( m_debug, "npc::go_to_destination with no goal" );
4194 move_pause();
4195 reach_omt_destination();
4196 return;
4197 }
4198 const tripoint_abs_omt omt_pos = global_omt_location();
4199 if( goal == omt_pos ) {
4200 // We're at our desired map square! Pause to keep the NPC infinite loop counter happy
4201 move_pause();
4202 reach_omt_destination();
4203 return;
4204 }
4205 if( !path.empty() ) {
4206 // we already have a path, just use that until we can't.
4207 move_to_next();
4208 return;
4209 }
4210 // get the next path point
4211 if( omt_path.back() == omt_pos ) {
4212 // this should be the square we are at.
4213 omt_path.pop_back();
4214 }
4215 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4216 point_rel_omt omt_diff = omt_path.back().xy() - omt_pos.xy();
4217 if( omt_diff.x() > 3 || omt_diff.x() < -3 || omt_diff.y() > 3 || omt_diff.y() < -3 ) {
4218 // we've gone wandering somehow, reset destination.
4219 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
4220 set_omt_destination();
4221 } else {
4222 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4223 }
4224 return;
4225 }
4226 }
4227 // TODO: fix point types
4228 tripoint sm_tri =
4229 here.getlocal( project_to<coords::ms>( omt_path.back() ).raw() );
4230 tripoint centre_sub = sm_tri + point( SEEX, SEEY );
4231 if( !here.passable( centre_sub ) ) {
4232 auto candidates = here.points_in_radius( centre_sub, 2 );
4233 for( const auto &elem : candidates ) {
4234 if( here.passable( elem ) ) {
4235 centre_sub = elem;
4236 break;
4237 }
4238 }
4239 }
4240 path = here.route( pos(), centre_sub, get_pathfinding_settings(), get_path_avoid() );
4241 add_msg( m_debug, "%s going %s->%s", name, omt_pos.to_string(), goal.to_string() );
4242
4243 if( !path.empty() ) {
4244 move_to_next();
4245 return;
4246 }
4247 move_pause();
4248}

std::vector< tripoint_abs_omt > omt_path

◆ good_escape_direction()

tripoint npc::good_escape_direction ( bool  include_pos = true)

228 zone_type_id retreat_zone = zone_type_id( "NPC_RETREAT" );
229 const tripoint &abs_pos = global_square_location();
230 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
231 cata::optional<tripoint> retreat_target = mgr.get_nearest( retreat_zone, abs_pos, 60,
232 fac_id );
233 if( retreat_target && *retreat_target != abs_pos ) {
234 update_path( here.getlocal( *retreat_target ) );
235 if( !path.empty() ) {
236 return path[0];
237 }
238 }
239 }
240
241 std::vector<tripoint> candidates;
242
243 const auto rate_pt = [&]( const tripoint & pt, const float threat_val ) {
244 if( !can_move_to( pt, !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_bash ) ) ) {
245 return MAX_FLOAT;
246 }
247 float rating = threat_val;
248 for( const auto &e : here.field_at( pt ) ) {
249 if( is_dangerous_field( e.second ) ) {
250 // TODO: Rate fire higher than smoke
251 rating += e.second.get_field_intensity();
252 }
253 }
254 return rating;
255 };
256
257 float best_rating = include_pos ? rate_pt( pos(), 0.0f ) : FLT_MAX;
258 candidates.emplace_back( pos() );
259
260 std::map<direction, float> adj_map;
261 for( direction pt_dir : npc_threat_dir ) {
262 const tripoint &pt = pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir );
263 float cur_rating = rate_pt( pt, ai_cache.threat_map[ pt_dir ] );
264 adj_map[pt_dir] = cur_rating;
265 if( cur_rating == best_rating ) {
266 candidates.emplace_back( pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir ) );
267 } else if( cur_rating < best_rating ) {
268 candidates.clear();
269 candidates.emplace_back( pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir ) );
270 best_rating = cur_rating;
271 }
272 }
273 return random_entry( candidates );
274}
zone_manager
