◆ handle_sound()

void npc::handle_sound ( sounds::sound_t  priority,
const std::string &  description,
int  heard_volume,
const tripoint &  spos 
)

Definition at line 625 of file npctalk.cpp.

627{
628 const tripoint s_abs_pos = g->m.getabs( spos );
629 const tripoint my_abs_pos = g->m.getabs( pos() );
630
631 add_msg( m_debug, "%s heard '%s', priority %d at volume %d from %d:%d, my pos %d:%d",
632 disp_name(), description, static_cast<int>( spriority ), heard_volume,
633 s_abs_pos.x, s_abs_pos.y, my_abs_pos.x, my_abs_pos.y );
634
635 bool player_ally = g->u.pos() == spos && is_player_ally();
636 player *const sound_source = g->critter_at<player>( spos );
637 bool npc_ally = sound_source && sound_source->is_npc() && is_ally( *sound_source );
638
639 if( ( player_ally || npc_ally ) && spriority == sounds::sound_t::order ) {
640 say( "<acknowledged>" );
641 }
642
643 if( sees( spos ) || is_hallucination() ) {
644 return;
645 }
646 // ignore low priority sounds if the NPC "knows" it came from a friend.
647 // TODO: NPC will need to respond to talking noise eventually
648 // but only for bantering purposes, not for investigating.
649 if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::alarm ) {
650 if( player_ally ) {
651 add_msg( m_debug, "Allied NPC ignored same faction %s", name );
652 return;
653 }
654 if( npc_ally ) {
655 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC ignored same faction %s", name );
656 return;
657 }
658 }
659 // discount if sound source is player, or seen by player,
660 // and listener is friendly and sound source is combat or alert only.
661 if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::alarm && g->u.sees( spos ) ) {
662 if( is_player_ally() ) {
663 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s ignored low priority noise that player can see", name );
664 return;
665 // discount if sound source is player, or seen by player,
666 // listener is neutral and sound type is worth investigating.
667 } else if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::destructive_activity &&
668 get_attitude_group( get_attitude() ) != attitude_group::hostile ) {
669 return;
670 }
671 }
672 // patrolling guards will investigate more readily than stationary NPCS
673 int investigate_dist = 10;
674 if( mission == NPC_MISSION_GUARD_ALLY || mission == NPC_MISSION_GUARD_PATROL ) {
675 investigate_dist = 50;
676 }
677 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::ignore_noise ) ) {
678 investigate_dist = 0;
679 }
680 if( ai_cache.total_danger < 1.0f ) {
681 if( spriority == sounds::sound_t::movement && !in_vehicle ) {
682 warn_about( "movement_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes, description );
683 } else if( spriority > sounds::sound_t::movement ) {
684 if( ( spriority == sounds::sound_t::speech || spriority == sounds::sound_t::alert ||
685 spriority == sounds::sound_t::order ) && sound_source &&
686 !has_faction_relationship( *sound_source, npc_factions::knows_your_voice ) ) {
687 warn_about( "speech_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes );
688 } else if( spriority > sounds::sound_t::activity ) {
689 warn_about( "combat_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes );
690 }
691 bool should_check = rl_dist( pos(), spos ) < investigate_dist;
692 if( should_check ) {
693 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
694 if( mgr.has( zone_type_npc_no_investigate, s_abs_pos, fac_id ) ) {
695 should_check = false;
696 } else if( mgr.has( zone_type_npc_investigate_only, my_abs_pos, fac_id ) &&
697 !mgr.has( zone_type_npc_investigate_only, s_abs_pos, fac_id ) ) {
698 should_check = false;
699 }
700 }
701 if( should_check ) {
702 add_msg( m_debug, "%s added noise at pos %d:%d", name, s_abs_pos.x, s_abs_pos.y );
703 dangerous_sound temp_sound;
704 temp_sound.abs_pos = s_abs_pos;
705 temp_sound.volume = heard_volume;
706 temp_sound.type = spriority;
707 if( !ai_cache.sound_alerts.empty() ) {
708 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.back().abs_pos != s_abs_pos ) {
709 ai_cache.sound_alerts.push_back( temp_sound );
710 }
711 } else {
712 ai_cache.sound_alerts.push_back( temp_sound );
713 }
714 }
715 }
716 }
717}

healing_options npc::has_healing_options ( healing_options  try_to_fix)

Definition at line 1849 of file npc.cpp.

1850{
1851 healing_options can_fix;
1852 can_fix.clear_all();
1853 healing_options *fix_p = &can_fix;
1854
1855 visit_items( [&fix_p, try_to_fix]( item * node ) {
1856 const auto use = node->type->get_use( "heal" );
1857 if( use == nullptr ) {
1858 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
1859 }
1860
1861 auto &actor = dynamic_cast<const heal_actor &>( *( use->get_actor_ptr() ) );
1862 if( try_to_fix.bandage && !fix_p->bandage && actor.bandages_power > 0.0f ) {
1863 fix_p->bandage = true;
1864 }
1865 if( try_to_fix.disinfect && !fix_p->disinfect && actor.disinfectant_power > 0.0f ) {
1866 fix_p->disinfect = true;
1867 }
1868 if( try_to_fix.bleed && !fix_p->bleed && actor.bleed > 0 ) {
1869 fix_p->bleed = true;
1870 }
1871 if( try_to_fix.bite && !fix_p->bite && actor.bite > 0 ) {
1872 fix_p->bite = true;
1873 }
1874 if( try_to_fix.infect && !fix_p->infect && actor.infect > 0 ) {
1875 fix_p->infect = true;
1876 }
1877 // if we've found items for everything we're looking for, we're done
1878 if( ( !try_to_fix.bandage || fix_p->bandage ) &&
1879 ( !try_to_fix.disinfect || fix_p->disinfect ) &&
1880 ( !try_to_fix.bleed || fix_p->bleed ) &&
1881 ( !try_to_fix.bite || fix_p->bite ) &&
1882 ( !try_to_fix.infect || fix_p->infect ) ) {
1883 return VisitResponse::ABORT;
1884 }
1885
1886 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
1887 } );
1888 return can_fix;
1889}

◆ hp_description()

std::pair< std::string, nc_color > npc::hp_description ( ) const

Definition at line 3022 of file npc.cpp.

3023{
3024 int cur_hp = hp_percentage();
3025 std::string damage_info;
3026 std::string pronoun;
3027 if( male ) {
3028 pronoun = _( "He " );
3029 } else {
3030 pronoun = _( "She " );
3031 }
3032 nc_color col;
3033 if( cur_hp == 100 ) {
3034 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is uninjured." );
3035 col = c_green;
3036 } else if( cur_hp >= 80 ) {
3037 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is lightly injured." );
3038 col = c_light_green;
3039 } else if( cur_hp >= 60 ) {
3040 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is moderately injured." );
3041 col = c_yellow;
3042 } else if( cur_hp >= 30 ) {
3043 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is heavily injured." );
3044 col = c_yellow;
3045 } else if( cur_hp >= 10 ) {
3046 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is severely injured." );
3047 col = c_light_red;
3048 } else {
3049 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is nearly dead!" );
3050 col = c_red;
3051 }

)
virtual

Asks how to use the item (if it has more than one use_method) and uses it.

Returns true if it destroys the item. Consumes charges from the item. Multi-use items are ONLY supported when all use_methods are iuse_actor!

1422 data.read( "dead", dead );
1423 data.read( "patience", patience );
1424 if( data.has_number( "myclass" ) ) {
1425 data.read( "myclass", classtmp );
1426 myclass = npc_class::from_legacy_int( classtmp );
1427 } else if( data.has_string( "myclass" ) ) {

1429 myclass = npc_class_id( classid );
1430 }

1432 data.read( "personality", personality );
1433 if( !data.read( "submap_coords", submap_coords ) ) {
1434 // Old submap coordinates are for the point (0, 0, 0) on local map
1435 // New ones are for submap that contains pos
1436 point old_coords;
1437 data.read( "mapx", old_coords.x );
1438 data.read( "mapy", old_coords.y );
1439 int o = 0;
1440 if( data.read( "omx", o ) ) {
1441 old_coords.x += o * OMAPX * 2;
1442 }
1443 if( data.read( "omy", o ) ) {
1444 old_coords.y += o * OMAPY * 2;
1445 }
1446 submap_coords = old_coords + point( posx() / SEEX, posy() / SEEY );
1447 }
1448
1449 if( !data.read( "mapz", position.z ) ) {
1450 data.read( "omz", position.z ); // omz/mapz got moved to position.z
1451 }
1452

1454 last_player_seen_pos.emplace();

1456 data.read( "ply", last_player_seen_pos->y );
1457 if( !data.read( "plz", last_player_seen_pos->z ) ) {
1458 last_player_seen_pos->z = posz();
1459 }
1460 // old code used tripoint_min to indicate "not a valid point"
1461 if( *last_player_seen_pos == tripoint_min ) {
1462 last_player_seen_pos.reset();
1463 }
1464 } else {
1465 data.read( "last_player_seen_pos", last_player_seen_pos );

1478 current_activity_id = activity.id();
1479 }

1501 NPC_MISSION_LEGACY_3
1502 }
1503 };
1504 if( legacy_missions.count( mission ) > 0 ) {
1505 mission = NPC_MISSION_NULL;
1506 }
1507 }

1509 previous_mission = static_cast<npc_mission>( misstmp );

1511 NPC_MISSION_LEGACY_1, NPC_MISSION_LEGACY_2,
1512 NPC_MISSION_LEGACY_3
1513 }
1514 };

1516 previous_mission = NPC_MISSION_NULL;
1517 }

1521 fac_id = faction_id( facID );
1522 }

1525 faction_api_version = temp_fac_api_ver;
1526 } else {
1527 faction_api_version = 0;
1528 }
1529

1539 }

1546 }
1547 };

1549 previous_attitude = NPCATT_NULL;
1550 }
1551 }

1555 }

1566 companion_mission_role_id = companion_mission_role;
1567 }
1568
1569 std::vector<tripoint_abs_omt> companion_mission_pts;
1570 data.read( "companion_mission_points", companion_mission_pts );
1571 if( !companion_mission_pts.empty() ) {
1572 for( auto pt : companion_mission_pts ) {
1573 companion_mission_points.push_back( pt );
1574 }
1575 }
1576
1577 if( !data.read( "companion_mission_time", companion_mission_t ) ) {
1578 companion_mission_time = calendar::before_time_starts;
1579 } else {
1580 companion_mission_time = companion_mission_t;
1581 }
1582

1584 companion_mission_time_ret = calendar::before_time_starts;
1585 } else {
1586 companion_mission_time_ret = companion_mission_t_r;
1587 }
1588

1591 JsonIn *invin_mission = data.get_raw( "companion_mission_inv" );
1592 companion_mission_inv.json_load_items( *invin_mission );
1593 }
1594
1595 if( !data.read( "restock", restock ) ) {
1596 restock = calendar::before_time_starts;
1597 }
1598
1599 data.read( "op_of_u", op_of_u );
1600 data.read( "chatbin", chatbin );
1601 if( !data.read( "rules", rules ) ) {
1602 data.read( "misc_rules", rules );
1603 data.read( "combat_rules", rules );
1604 }
1605 real_weapon = item( "null", calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
1606 data.read( "real_weapon", real_weapon );
1607 cbm_weapon_index = -1;
1608 data.read( "cbm_weapon_index", cbm_weapon_index );

1611 last_updated = calendar::turn;
1612 }
1613 complaints.clear();

◆ method_of_attack()

npc_action npc::method_of_attack ( )

Definition at line 1311 of file npcmove.cpp.

1312{
1313 Creature *critter = current_target();
1314 if( critter == nullptr ) {
1315 // This function shouldn't be called...
1316 debugmsg( "Ran npc::method_of_attack without a target!" );
1317 return npc_pause;
1318 }
1319
1320 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
1321 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
1322 double danger = evaluate_enemy( *critter );
1323 const bool has_los = clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar, false );
1324 const bool same_z = tar.z == pos().z;
1325
1326 // TODO: Change the in_vehicle check to actual "are we driving" check
1327 const bool dont_move = in_vehicle || rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE ||
1328 rules.engagement == combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE;
1329 // NPCs engage in free fire can move to avoid allies, but not if they're in a vehicle
1330 const bool dont_move_ff = in_vehicle || rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE;
1331
1332 // if there's enough of a threat to be here, power up the combat CBMs
1333 activate_combat_cbms();
1334
1335 int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
1336
1337 // get any suitable modes excluding melee, any forbidden to NPCs and those without ammo
1338 // if we require a silent weapon inappropriate modes are also removed
1339 // except in emergency only fire bursts if danger > 0.5 and don't shoot at all at harmless targets
1340 std::vector<std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode>> modes;
1341 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) || !is_player_ally() ) {
1342 for( const auto &e : weapon.gun_all_modes() ) {
1343 modes.push_back( e );
1344 }
1345
1346 modes.erase( std::remove_if( modes.begin(), modes.end(),
1347 [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &e ) {
1348
1349 const auto &m = e.second;
1350 return m.melee() || m.flags.count( "NPC_AVOID" ) ||
1351 !m->ammo_sufficient( m.qty ) || !can_use( *m.target ) ||
1352 m->get_gun_ups_drain() > ups_charges ||
1353 ( ( danger <= ( m.qty == 1 ? 3.0 : 15.0 ) ) && !emergency() ) ||
1354 ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) && is_player_ally() &&
1355 !m.target->is_silent() );
1356
1357 } ), modes.end() );
1358 }
1359
1360 // prefer modes that result in more total damage
1361 std::stable_sort( modes.begin(),
1362 modes.end(), [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &lhs,
1363 const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &rhs ) {
1364 return ( lhs.second->gun_damage().total_damage() * lhs.second.qty ) >
1365 ( rhs.second->gun_damage().total_damage() * rhs.second.qty );
1366 } );
1367
1368 const int cur_recoil = recoil_total();
1369 // modes outside confident range should always be the last option(s)
1370 std::stable_sort( modes.begin(),
1371 modes.end(), [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &lhs,
1372 const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &rhs ) {
1373 return ( confident_gun_mode_range( lhs.second, cur_recoil ) >= dist ) >
1374 ( confident_gun_mode_range( rhs.second, cur_recoil ) >= dist );
1375 } );
1376
1377 if( emergency() && alt_attack() ) {
1378 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying an alternate attack", disp_name() );
1379 return npc_noop;
1380 }
1381
1382 // reach attacks are silent and consume no ammo so prefer these if available
1383 int reach_range = weapon.reach_range( *this );
1384 if( !trigdist ) {
1385 if( reach_range > 1 && reach_range >= dist && clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar ) ) {
1386 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a reach attack", disp_name() );
1387 return npc_reach_attack;
1388 }
1389 } else {
1390 if( reach_range > 1 && reach_range >= std::round( trig_dist( pos(), tar ) ) &&
1391 clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar ) ) {
1392 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a reach attack", disp_name() );
1393 return npc_reach_attack;
1394 }
1395 }
1396
1397 // if the best mode is within the confident range try for a shot
1398 if( !modes.empty() && sees( *critter ) && has_los &&
1399 confident_gun_mode_range( modes[ 0 ].second, cur_recoil ) >= dist ) {
1400 if( cbm_weapon_index > 0 && !weapon.ammo_sufficient() && can_reload_current() ) {
1401 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is reloading", disp_name() );
1402 return npc_reload;
1403 }
1404
1405 if( wont_hit_friend( tar, weapon, false ) ) {
1406 weapon.gun_set_mode( modes[ 0 ].first );
1407 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying to shoot someone", disp_name() );
1408 return npc_shoot;
1409
1410 } else {
1411 if( !dont_move_ff ) {
1412 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying to avoid friendly fire", disp_name() );
1413 return npc_avoid_friendly_fire;
1414 }
1415 }
1416 }
1417
1418 if( dist == 1 && same_z ) {
1419 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a melle attack", disp_name() );
1420 return npc_melee;
1421 }
1422
1423 // don't mess with CBM weapons
1424 if( cbm_weapon_index < 0 ) {
1425 // TODO: Add a time check now that wielding takes a lot of time
1426 if( wield_better_weapon() ) {
1427 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is changing weapons", disp_name() );
1428 return npc_noop;
1429 }
1430
1431 if( !weapon.ammo_sufficient() && can_reload_current() ) {
1432 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is reloading", disp_name() );
1433 return npc_reload;
1434 }
1435 }
1436
1437 // TODO: Needs a check for transparent but non-passable tiles on the way
1438 if( !modes.empty() && sees( *critter ) && aim_per_move( weapon, recoil ) > 0 &&
1439 confident_shoot_range( weapon, get_most_accurate_sight( weapon ) ) >= dist ) {
1440 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is aiming" );
1441 return npc_aim;
1442 }
1443 add_msg( m_debug, "%s can't figure out what to do", disp_name() );
1444 return ( dont_move || !same_z ) ? npc_undecided : npc_melee;
1445}
trigdist
bool trigdist
Circular distances.
Definition: cached_options.cpp:12

Definition: ranged.cpp:2060

784 action = npc_heal;

821 } else {
822 // No present danger
823 deactivate_combat_cbms();

832 }
833

874 }
875 }

900 action = goal == global_omt_location() ? npc_pause : npc_goto_destination;

903 return;

905 find_item();

907 } else if( assigned_camp ) {

919 // No items, so follow the player?

930

932 * "following" means standing still. If that's the case, if there are any
933 * monsters around, we should attack them after all!
934 *

2704{
2705 if( spheres.empty() ) {
2706 return;
2707 }
2708
2709 tripoint minp( pos() );
2710 tripoint maxp( pos() );
2711
2712 for( const auto &elem : spheres ) {
2713 minp.x = std::min( minp.x, elem.center.x - elem.radius );
2714 minp.y = std::min( minp.y, elem.center.y - elem.radius );
2715 maxp.x = std::max( maxp.x, elem.center.x + elem.radius );
2716 maxp.y = std::max( maxp.y, elem.center.y + elem.radius );
2717 }
2718
2719 const tripoint_range<tripoint> range( minp, maxp );
2720
2721 std::vector<tripoint> escape_points;
2722
2723 map &here = get_map();
2724 std::copy_if( range.begin(), range.end(), std::back_inserter( escape_points ),
2725 [&here]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2726 return here.passable( elem );
2727 } );
2728
2729 cata::sort_by_rating( escape_points.begin(), escape_points.end(), [&]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2730 const int danger = std::accumulate( spheres.begin(), spheres.end(), 0,
2731 [&]( const int sum, const sphere & s ) {
2732 return sum + std::max( s.radius - rl_dist( elem, s.center ), 0 );
2733 } );
2734
2735 const int distance = rl_dist( pos(), elem );
2736 const int move_cost = here.move_cost( elem );
2737
2738 return std::make_tuple( danger, distance, move_cost );
2739 } );
2740

2742 update_path( elem, no_bashing );
2743
2744 if( elem == pos() || !path.empty() ) {
2745 break;
2746 }
2747 }
2748

2750 move_to_next();
2751 } else {
2752 move_pause();

◆ move_away_from() [2/2]

void npc::move_away_from ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  no_bash_atk = false,
std::set< tripoint > *  nomove = nullptr 
)

Definition at line 2516 of file npcmove.cpp.

2517{
2518 tripoint best_pos = pos();
2519 int best = -1;
2520 int chance = 2;
2521 map &here = get_map();
2522 for( const tripoint &p : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
2523 if( nomove != nullptr && nomove->find( p ) != nomove->end() ) {
2524 continue;
2525 }
2526
2527 if( p == pos() ) {
2528 continue;
2529 }
2530
2531 if( p == get_player_character().pos() ) {
2532 continue;
2533 }
2534
2535 const int cost = here.combined_movecost( pos(), p );
2536 if( cost <= 0 ) {
2537 continue;
2538 }
2539
2540 const int dst = std::abs( p.x - pt.x ) + std::abs( p.y - pt.y ) + std::abs( p.z - pt.z );
2541 const int val = dst * 1000 / cost;
2542 if( val > best && can_move_to( p, no_bash_atk ) ) {
2543 best_pos = p;
2544 best = val;
2545 chance = 2;
2546 } else if( ( val == best && one_in( chance ) ) && can_move_to( p, no_bash_atk ) ) {
2547 best_pos = p;
2548 best = val;
2549 chance++;
2550 }
2551 }
2552
2553 move_to( best_pos, no_bash_atk, nomove );
2554}

2255 bool attacking = false;
2256 if( g->critter_at<monster>( p ) ) {
2257 attacking = true;
2258 }
2259 if( !move_effects( attacking ) ) {
2260 mod_moves( -100 );
2261 return;
2262 }
2263
2264 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p );
2265 if( critter != nullptr ) {
2266 if( critter == this ) { // We're just pausing!
2267 move_pause();
2268 return;
2269 }
2270 const auto att = attitude_to( *critter );
2271 if( att == A_HOSTILE ) {
2272 if( !no_bashing ) {
2273 warn_about( "cant_flee", 5_turns + rng( 0, 5 ) * 1_turns );
2274 melee_attack( *critter, true );
2275 } else {
2276 move_pause();
2277 }
2278
2279 return;
2280 }
2281
2282 if( critter->is_avatar() ) {
2283 say( "<let_me_pass>" );
2284 }
2285
2286 // Let NPCs push each other when non-hostile
2287 // TODO: Have them attack each other when hostile
2288 npc *np = dynamic_cast<npc *>( critter );
2289 if( np != nullptr && !np->in_sleep_state() ) {
2290 std::unique_ptr<std::set<tripoint>> newnomove;
2291 std::set<tripoint> *realnomove;
2292 if( nomove != nullptr ) {
2293 realnomove = nomove;
2294 } else {
2295 // create the no-move list
2296 newnomove = std::make_unique<std::set<tripoint>>();
2297 realnomove = newnomove.get();
2298 }
2299 // other npcs should not try to move into this npc anymore,
2300 // so infinite loop can be avoided.
2301 realnomove->insert( pos() );
2302 say( "<let_me_pass>" );
2303 np->move_away_from( pos(), true, realnomove );
2304 // if we moved NPC, readjust their path, so NPCs don't jostle each other out of their activity paths.
2305 if( np->attitude == NPCATT_ACTIVITY ) {
2306 std::vector<tripoint> activity_route = np->get_auto_move_route();
2307 if( !activity_route.empty() && !np->has_destination_activity() ) {
2308 tripoint final_destination;
2309 if( destination_point ) {
2310 final_destination = here.getlocal( *destination_point );
2311 } else {
2312 final_destination = activity_route.back();
2313 }
2314 np->update_path( final_destination );
2315 }
2316 }
2317 }
2318
2319 if( critter->pos() == p ) {
2320 move_pause();
2321 return;
2322 }
2323 }
2324
2325 // Boarding moving vehicles is fine, unboarding isn't
2326 bool moved = false;
2327 if( const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( pos() ) ) {
2328 const optional_vpart_position ovp = here.veh_at( p );
2329 if( vp->vehicle().is_moving() &&
2330 ( veh_pointer_or_null( ovp ) != veh_pointer_or_null( vp ) ||
2331 !ovp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) ) ) {
2332 move_pause();
2333 return;
2334 }
2335 }
2336
2337 if( p.z != posz() ) {
2338 // Z-level move
2339 // For now just teleport to the destination
2340 // TODO: Make it properly find the tile to move to
2341 if( is_mounted() ) {
2342 move_pause();
2343 return;
2344 }
2345 moves -= 100;
2346 moved = true;
2347 } else if( here.passable( p ) && !here.has_flag( "DOOR", p ) ) {
2348 bool diag = trigdist && posx() != p.x && posy() != p.y;
2349 if( is_mounted() ) {
2350 const double base_moves = run_cost( here.combined_movecost( pos(), p ),
2351 diag ) * 100.0 / mounted_creature->get_speed();
2352 const double encumb_moves = get_weight() / 4800.0_gram;
2353 moves -= static_cast<int>( std::ceil( base_moves + encumb_moves ) );
2354 if( mounted_creature->has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
2355 mounted_creature->use_mech_power( -1 );
2356 }
2357 } else {
2358 moves -= run_cost( here.combined_movecost( pos(), p ), diag );
2359 }
2360 moved = true;
2361 } else if( here.open_door( p, !here.is_outside( pos() ), true ) ) {
2362 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations don't open doors
2363 here.open_door( p, !here.is_outside( pos() ) );
2364 moves -= 100;
2365 } else { // hallucinations teleport through doors
2366 moves -= 100;
2367 moved = true;
2368 }
2369 } else if( get_dex() > 1 && here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ) {
2370 ///\EFFECT_DEX_NPC increases chance to climb CLIMBABLE furniture or terrain
2371 int climb = get_dex();
2372 if( one_in( climb ) ) {
2373 add_msg_if_npc( m_neutral, _( "%1$s tries to climb the %2$s but slips." ), name,
2374 here.tername( p ) );
2375 moves -= 400;
2376 } else {
2377 add_msg_if_npc( m_neutral, _( "%1$s climbs over the %2$s." ), name, here.tername( p ) );
2378 moves -= ( 500 - ( rng( 0, climb ) * 20 ) );
2379 moved = true;
2380 }
2381 } else if( !no_bashing && smash_ability() > 0 && here.is_bashable( p ) &&
2382 here.bash_rating( smash_ability(), p ) > 0 ) {
2383 moves -= !is_armed() ? 80 : weapon.attack_cost() * 0.8;
2384 here.bash( p, smash_ability() );
2385 } else {
2386 if( attitude == NPCATT_MUG ||
2387 attitude == NPCATT_KILL ||
2388 attitude == NPCATT_WAIT_FOR_LEAVE ) {
2389 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
2390 }
2391
2392 moves = 0;
2393 }
2394
2395 if( moved ) {
2396 const tripoint old_pos = pos();
2397 setpos( p );
2398 if( old_pos.x - p.x < 0 ) {
2399 facing = FD_RIGHT;
2400 } else {
2401 facing = FD_LEFT;
2402 }
2403 if( is_mounted() ) {
2404 if( mounted_creature->pos() != pos() ) {
2405 mounted_creature->setpos( pos() );
2406 mounted_creature->facing = facing;
2407 mounted_creature->process_triggers();
2408 here.creature_in_field( *mounted_creature );
2409 here.creature_on_trap( *mounted_creature );
2410 }
2411 }
2412 if( here.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", pos() ) ) {
2413 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
2414 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
2415 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
2416 }
2417
2418 if( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_SIGHT, pos() ) ) {
2419 add_effect( effect_no_sight, 1_turns, num_bp );
2420 } else if( has_effect( effect_no_sight ) ) {
2421 remove_effect( effect_no_sight );
2422 }
2423
2424 if( in_vehicle ) {
2425 here.unboard_vehicle( old_pos );
2426 }
2427
2428 // Close doors behind self (if you can)
2429 if( ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::close_doors ) && is_player_ally() ) && !is_hallucination() ) {
2430 doors::close_door( here, *this, old_pos );
2431 }
2432
2433 if( here.veh_at( p ).part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) ) {
2434 here.board_vehicle( p, this );
2435 }
2436
2437 here.creature_on_trap( *this );
2438 here.creature_in_field( *this );
2439 }
2440}

3905 if( mark.is_armed() ) {
3906 make_angry();
3907 }

3909 if( rl_dist( pos(), mark.pos() ) > 1 ) { // We have to travel
3910 update_path( mark.pos() );
3911 move_to_next();
3912 return;
3913 }
3914
3915 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3916 const bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( mark );
3917 if( mark.cash > 0 ) {
3918 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't take items
3919 cash += mark.cash;
3920 mark.cash = 0;
3921 }
3922 moves = 0;
3923 // Describe the action
3924 if( mark.is_npc() ) {
3925 if( u_see ) {
3926 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes %2$s's money!" ), name, mark.name );
3927 }
3928 } else {
3929 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%s takes your money!" ), name );
3930 }
3931 return;
3932 }
3933
3934 // We already have their money; take some goodies!
3935 // value_mod affects at what point we "take the money and run"
3936 // A lower value means we'll take more stuff
3937 double value_mod = 1 - ( ( 10 - personality.bravery ) * .05 ) -
3938 ( ( 10 - personality.aggression ) * .04 ) -
3939 ( ( 10 - personality.collector ) * .06 );

3941 value_mod += ( op_of_u.fear * .08 );
3942 value_mod -= ( ( 8 - op_of_u.value ) * .07 );
3943 }
3944 double best_value = minimum_item_value() * value_mod;

3948 item &front_stack = stack->front();

3950 can_pick_volume( front_stack ) &&
3951 can_pick_weight( front_stack, true ) ) {
3952 best_value = value( front_stack );
3953 to_steal = &front_stack;
3954 }
3955 }
3956 if( to_steal == nullptr ) { // Didn't find anything worthwhile!
3957 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
3958 if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
3959 say( "<done_mugging>" );
3960 }
3961 moves -= 100;
3962 return;
3963 }

3966 stolen = mark.i_rem( to_steal );
3967 i_add( stolen );
3968 }
3969 if( mark.is_npc() ) {

3972 }
3973 } else {
3974 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%1$s takes your %2$s." ), name, stolen.tname() );
3975 }
3976 moves -= 100;
3977 if( !mark.is_npc() ) {
3978 op_of_u.value -= rng( 0, 1 ); // Decrease the value of the player
3979 }

◆ on_load()

void npc::on_load ( )

Retroactively update npc.

Definition at line 2655 of file npc.cpp.

2656{
2657 const auto advance_effects = [&]( const time_duration & elapsed_dur ) {
2658 for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
2659 for( auto &_effect_it : elem.second ) {
2660 effect &e = _effect_it.second;
2661 const time_duration &time_left = e.get_duration();
2662 if( time_left > 1_turns ) {
2663 if( time_left < elapsed_dur ) {
2664 e.set_duration( 1_turns );
2665 } else {
2666 e.set_duration( time_left - elapsed_dur );
2667 }
2668 }
2669 }
2670 }
2671 };
2672 // Cap at some reasonable number, say 2 days
2673 const time_duration dt = std::min( calendar::turn - last_updated, 2_days );
2674 // TODO: Sleeping, healing etc.
2675 last_updated = calendar::turn;
2676 time_point cur = calendar::turn - dt;
2677 add_msg( m_debug, "on_load() by %s, %d turns", name, to_turns<int>( dt ) );
2678 // First update with 30 minute granularity, then 5 minutes, then turns
2679 for( ; cur < calendar::turn - 30_minutes; cur += 30_minutes + 1_turns ) {
2680 update_body( cur, cur + 30_minutes );
2681 advance_effects( 30_minutes );
2682 }
2683 for( ; cur < calendar::turn - 5_minutes; cur += 5_minutes + 1_turns ) {
2684 update_body( cur, cur + 5_minutes );
2685 advance_effects( 5_minutes );
2686 }
2687 for( ; cur < calendar::turn; cur += 1_turns ) {
2688 update_body( cur, cur + 1_turns );
2689 process_effects();
2690 }
2691
2692 if( dt > 0_turns ) {
2693 // This ensures food is properly rotten at load
2694 // Otherwise NPCs try to eat rotten food and fail
2695 process_items();
2696 // give NPCs that are doing activities a pile of moves
2697 if( has_destination() || activity ) {
2698 mod_moves( to_moves<int>( dt ) );
2699 }
2700 }
2701
2702 // Not necessarily true, but it's not a bad idea to set this
2703 has_new_items = true;
2704
2705 // for spawned npcs
2706 if( g->m.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", pos() ) ) {
2707 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
2708 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
2709 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
2710 }
2711 if( g->m.veh_at( pos() ).part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) && !in_vehicle ) {
2712 g->m.board_vehicle( pos(), this );
2713 }
2714 if( has_effect( effect_riding ) && !mounted_creature ) {
2715 if( const monster *const mon = g->critter_at<monster>( pos() ) ) {
2716 mounted_creature = g->shared_from( *mon );
2717 } else {
2718 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC is meant to be riding, though the mount is not found when %s is loaded",
2719 disp_name() );
2720 }
2721 }
2722 if( has_trait( trait_HALLUCINATION ) ) {
2723 hallucination = true;
2724 }
2725}

◆ place_on_map()

void npc::place_on_map ( )

Places the NPC on the map.

This update its pos values to fit the current offset of map (g->levx, g->levy). If the square on the map where the NPC would go is not empty a spiral search for an empty square around it is performed.

Definition at line 743 of file npc.cpp.

744{
745 // The global absolute position (in map squares) of the npc is *always*
746 // "submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx() % SEEX" (analog for y).
747 // The main map assumes that pos is in its own (local to the main map)
748 // coordinate system. We have to change pos to match that assumption
749 const point dm( submap_coords + point( -g->get_levx(), -g->get_levy() ) );
750 const point offset( position.x % SEEX, position.y % SEEY );
751 // value of "submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx()" is unchanged
752 setpos( tripoint( offset.x + dm.x * SEEX, offset.y + dm.y * SEEY, posz() ) );
753
754 if( g->is_empty( pos() ) || is_mounted() ) {
755 return;
756 }
757
758 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), SEEX + 1 ) ) {
759 if( g->is_empty( p ) ) {
760 setpos( p );
761 return;
762 }
763 }
764
765 debugmsg( "Failed to place NPC in a valid location near (%d,%d,%d)", posx(), posy(), posz() );
766}

References closest_points_first(), debugmsg, g, Character::is_mounted(), Character::pos(), Character::position, Character::posx(), Character::posy(), Character::posz(), SEEX, SEEY, setpos(), submap_coords, point::x, tripoint::x, point::y, and tripoint::y.

◆ print_info()

int npc::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 2233 of file npc.cpp.

2234{
2235 const int last_line = line + vLines;
2236 const int iWidth = getmaxx( w ) - 2;
2237 // First line of w is the border; the next 4 are terrain info, and after that
2238 // is a blank line. w is 13 characters tall, and we can't use the last one
2239 // because it's a border as well; so we have lines 6 through 11.
2240 // w is also 48 characters wide - 2 characters for border = 46 characters for us
2241 mvwprintz( w, point( column, line++ ), c_white, _( "NPC: " ) );
2242 wprintz( w, basic_symbol_color(), name );
2243
2244 if( sees( g->u ) ) {
2245 mvwprintz( w, point( column, line++ ), c_yellow, _( "Aware of your presence!" ) );
2246 }
2247
2248 if( is_armed() ) {
2249 trim_and_print( w, point( column, line++ ), iWidth, c_red, _( "Wielding a %s" ), weapon.tname() );
2250 }
2251
2252 const auto enumerate_print = [ w, last_line, column, iWidth, &line ]( const std::string & str_in,
2253 nc_color color ) {
2254 const std::vector<std::string> folded = foldstring( str_in, iWidth );
2255 for( auto it = folded.begin(); it < folded.end() && line < last_line; ++it, ++line ) {
2256 trim_and_print( w, point( column, line ), iWidth, color, *it );
2257 }
2258 };
2259
2260 const std::string worn_str = enumerate_as_string( worn.begin(), worn.end(), []( const item & it ) {
2261 return it.tname();
2262 } );
2263 if( !worn_str.empty() ) {
2264 const std::string wearing = _( "Wearing: " ) + worn_str;
2265 enumerate_print( wearing, c_light_blue );
2266 }
2267
2268 // as of now, visibility of mutations is between 0 and 10
2269 // 10 perception and 10 distance would see all mutations - cap 0
2270 // 10 perception and 30 distance - cap 5, some mutations visible
2271 // 3 perception and 3 distance would see all mutations - cap 0
2272 // 3 perception and 15 distance - cap 5, some mutations visible
2273 // 3 perception and 20 distance would be barely able to discern huge antlers on a person - cap 10
2274 const int per = g->u.get_per();
2275 const int dist = rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() );
2276 int visibility_cap;
2277 if( per <= 1 ) {
2278 visibility_cap = INT_MAX;
2279 } else {
2280 visibility_cap = std::round( dist * dist / 20.0 / ( per - 1 ) );
2281 }
2282
2283 const auto trait_str = visible_mutations( visibility_cap );
2284 if( !trait_str.empty() ) {
2285 const std::string mutations = _( "Traits: " ) + trait_str;
2286 enumerate_print( mutations, c_green );
2287 }
2288
2289 return line;
2290}

std::string visible_mutations(int visibility_cap) const
Returns an enumeration of visible mutations with colors.

Definition: npc.cpp:2217

◆ process_turn()

void npc::process_turn ( )
overridevirtual

Handles end-of-turn processing.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 2798 of file npc.cpp.

2799{
2800 player::process_turn();
2801
2802 // NPCs shouldn't be using stamina, but if they have, set it back to max
2803 if( calendar::once_every( 1_minutes ) && get_stamina() < get_stamina_max() ) {
2804 set_stamina( get_stamina_max() );
2805 }
2806
2807 if( is_player_ally() && calendar::once_every( 1_hours ) &&
2808 get_kcal_percent() > 0.95 && get_thirst() < thirst_levels::very_thirsty && op_of_u.trust < 5 ) {
2809 // Friends who are well fed will like you more
2810 // 24 checks per day, best case chance at trust 0 is 1 in 48 for +1 trust per 2 days
2811 float trust_chance = 5 - op_of_u.trust;
2812 // Penalize for bad impression
2813 // TODO: Penalize for traits and actions (especially murder, unless NPC is psycho)
2814 int op_penalty = std::max( 0, op_of_u.anger ) +
2815 std::max( 0, -op_of_u.value ) +
2816 std::max( 0, op_of_u.fear );
2817 // Being barely hungry and thirsty, not in pain and not wounded means good care
2818 int state_penalty = ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 + get_thirst()
2819 + ( 100 - hp_percentage() ) + get_pain();
2820 if( x_in_y( trust_chance, 240 + 10 * op_penalty + state_penalty ) ) {
2821 op_of_u.trust++;
2822 }
2823
2824 // TODO: Similar checks for fear and anger
2825 }
2826
2827 // TODO: Add decreasing trust/value/etc. here when player doesn't provide food
2828 // TODO: Make NPCs leave the player if there's a path out of map and player is sleeping/unseen/etc.
2829}

4056 // and chill there indefinitely, the plan is to add systems for them to build
4057 // up their base, then go out on looting missions,
4058 // then return to base afterwards.

4060 if( !needs.empty() && needs[0] == need_safety ) {
4061 // we found our base.
4062 base_location = global_omt_location();
4063 }
4064 }
4065 return;
4066 }
4067 // Guarding NPCs want a specific point, not just an overmap tile

4070 goal = no_goal_point;
4071 return;
4072 }
4073 // If we are guarding, remember our position in case we get forcibly moved

4076 // This is the specific point
4077 return;
4078 }

4081 // No point recalculating the path to get home
4082 move_to_next();

4084 update_path( here.getlocal( guard_pos ) );
4085 move_to_next();

◆ reboot()

void npc::reboot ( )

2402{
2403 //The NPC got into an infinite loop, in game.cpp -monmove() - a debugmsg just popped up
2404 // informing player of this.
2405 // put them to sleep and reboot their brain.
2406 // they can be woken up by the player, and if their brain is fixed, great,
2407 // if not, they will faint again, and the NPC can be kept asleep until the bug is fixed.
2408 cancel_activity();
2409 path.clear();
2410 last_player_seen_pos = cata::nullopt;
2411 last_seen_player_turn = 999;
2412 wanted_item_pos = tripoint_min;
2413 guard_pos = tripoint_min;
2414 goal = no_goal_point;
2415 fetching_item = false;
2416 has_new_items = true;
2417 worst_item_value = 0;
2418 mission = NPC_MISSION_NULL;
2419 patience = 0;
2420 ai_cache.danger = 0;
2421 ai_cache.total_danger = 0;
2422 ai_cache.danger_assessment = 0;
2423 ai_cache.target.reset();
2424 ai_cache.ally.reset();
2425 ai_cache.can_heal.clear_all();
2426 ai_cache.sound_alerts.clear();

2428 ai_cache.stuck = 0;
2429 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
2430 ai_cache.my_weapon_value = 0;
2431 ai_cache.friends.clear();
2432 ai_cache.dangerous_explosives.clear();

2434 ai_cache.searched_tiles.clear();
2435 activity = player_activity();

◆ recharge_cbm()

bool npc::recharge_cbm ( )

Definition at line 1665 of file npcmove.cpp.

1666{
1667 // non-allied NPCs don't consume resources to recharge
1668 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
1669 mod_power_level( get_max_power_level() );
1670 return true;
1671 }
1672
1673 for( bionic_id &bid : get_fueled_bionics() ) {
1674 if( has_active_bionic( bid ) ) {
1675 continue;
1676 }
1677
1678 if( !get_fuel_available( bid ).empty() ) {
1679 use_bionic_by_id( bid );
1680 return true;
1681 } else {
1682 const std::function<bool( const item & )> fuel_filter = [bid]( const item & it ) {
1683 for( const itype_id &fid : bid->fuel_opts ) {
1684 return it.typeId() == fid || ( !it.is_container_empty() && it.contents.front().typeId() == fid );
1685 }
1686 return false;
1687 };
1688
1689 if( consume_cbm_items( fuel_filter ) ) {
1690 use_bionic_by_id( bid );
1691 return true;
1692 } else {
1693 const std::vector<itype_id> fuel_op = bid->fuel_opts;
1694 const bool need_alcohol =
1695 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_chem_ethanol ) !=
1696 fuel_op.end() ||
1697 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_chem_methanol ) !=
1698 fuel_op.end() ||
1699 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_denat_alcohol ) !=
1700 fuel_op.end();
1701
1702 if( std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_battery ) != fuel_op.end() ) {
1703 complain_about( "need_batteries", 3_hours, "<need_batteries>", false );
1704 } else if( need_alcohol ) {
1705 complain_about( "need_booze", 3_hours, "<need_booze>", false );
1706 } else {
1707 complain_about( "need_fuel", 3_hours, "<need_fuel>", false );
1708 }
1709 }
1710 }
1711 }
1712
1713 if( use_bionic_by_id( bio_furnace ) ) {
1714 const std::function<bool( const item & )> furnace_filter = []( const item & it ) {
1715 return it.typeId() == itype_id( "withered" ) || it.typeId() == itype_id( "file" ) ||
1716 it.has_flag( "FIREWOOD" );
1717 };
1718 if( consume_cbm_items( furnace_filter ) ) {
1719 return true;
1720 } else {
1721 complain_about( "need_junk", 3_hours, "<need_junk>", false );
1722 }
1723 }
1724
1725 if( use_bionic_by_id( bio_reactor ) || use_bionic_by_id( bio_advreactor ) ) {
1726 const std::function<bool( const item & )> reactor_filter = []( const item & it ) {
1727 return it.is_ammo() && ( it.ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ||
1728 it.ammo_type() == ammo_reactor_slurry );
1729 };
1730 if( consume_cbm_items( reactor_filter ) ) {
1731 return true;
1732 } else {
1733 complain_about( "need_radioactives", 3_hours, "<need_radioactives>", false );
1734 }
1735 }
1736
1737 return false;
1738}

696 goal = player_character.global_omt_location();

◆ set_attitude()

void npc::set_attitude ( npc_attitude  new_attitude)

Definition at line 3141 of file npc.cpp.

3142{
3143 if( new_attitude == attitude ) {
3144 return;
3145 }
3146 previous_attitude = attitude;
3147 if( new_attitude == NPCATT_FLEE ) {
3148 new_attitude = NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP;
3149 }
3150 if( new_attitude == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP && !has_effect( effect_npc_flee_player ) ) {
3151 add_effect( effect_npc_flee_player, 24_hours, num_bp );
3152 }
3153
3154 add_msg( m_debug, "%s changes attitude from %s to %s",
3155 name, npc_attitude_id( attitude ), npc_attitude_id( new_attitude ) );
3156 attitude_group new_group = get_attitude_group( new_attitude );
3157 attitude_group old_group = get_attitude_group( attitude );
3158 if( new_group != old_group && !is_fake() && g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
3159 switch( new_group ) {
3160 case attitude_group::hostile:
3161 add_msg_if_npc( m_bad, _( "<npcname> gets angry!" ) );
3162 break;
3163 case attitude_group::fearful:
3164 add_msg_if_npc( m_warning, _( "<npcname> gets scared!" ) );
3165 break;
3166 default:
3167 if( old_group == attitude_group::hostile ) {
3168 add_msg_if_npc( m_good, _( "<npcname> calms down." ) );
3169 } else if( old_group == attitude_group::fearful ) {
3170 add_msg_if_npc( _( "<npcname> is no longer afraid." ) );
3171 }
3172 break;
3173 }
3174 }
3175 attitude = new_attitude;

◆ set_omt_destination()

void npc::set_omt_destination ( )

Definition at line 4091 of file npcmove.cpp.

4092{
4093 /* TODO: Make NPCs' movement more intelligent.
4094 * Right now this function just makes them attempt to address their needs:
4095 * if we need ammo, go to a gun store, if we need food, go to a grocery store,
4096 * and if we don't have any needs, pick a random spot.
4097 * What it SHOULD do is that, if there's time; but also look at our mission and
4098 * our faction to determine more meaningful actions, such as attacking a rival
4099 * faction's base, or meeting up with someone friendly. NPCs should also
4100 * attempt to reach safety before nightfall, and possibly similar goals.
4101 * Also, NPCs should be able to assign themselves missions like "break into that
4102 * lab" or "map that river bank."
4103 */
4104 if( is_stationary( true ) ) {
4105 guard_current_pos();
4106 return;
4107 }
4108
4109 // all of the following luxuries are at ground level.
4110 // so please wallow in hunger & fear if below ground.
4111 if( posz() != 0 && !get_map().has_zlevels() ) {
4112 goal = no_goal_point;
4113 return;
4114 }
4115
4116 tripoint_abs_omt surface_omt_loc = global_omt_location();
4117 // We need that, otherwise find_closest won't work properly
4118 surface_omt_loc.z() = 0;
4119
4120 // also, don't bother looking if the CITY_SIZE is 0, just go somewhere at random
4121 const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4122 if( city_size == 0 ) {
4123 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4124 return;
4125 }
4126
4127 decide_needs();
4128 if( needs.empty() ) { // We don't need anything in particular.
4129 needs.push_back( need_none );
4130 }
4131
4132 std::string dest_type;
4133 for( const auto &fulfill : needs ) {
4134 // look for the closest occurence of any of that locations terrain types
4135 std::vector<oter_type_id> loc_list = get_location_for( fulfill )->get_all_terrains();
4136 std::shuffle( loc_list.begin(), loc_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4137 omt_find_params find_params;
4138 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type>> temp_types;
4139 for( const oter_type_id &elem : loc_list ) {
4140 std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type> temp_pair;
4141 temp_pair.first = elem.id().str();
4142 temp_pair.second = ot_match_type::type;
4143 temp_types.push_back( temp_pair );
4144 }
4145 find_params.search_range = 75;
4146 find_params.min_distance = 0;
4147 find_params.must_see = false;
4148 find_params.cant_see = false;
4149 find_params.types = temp_types;
4150 find_params.existing_only = false;
4151 goal = overmap_buffer.find_closest( surface_omt_loc, find_params );
4152 omt_path.clear();
4153 if( goal != overmap::invalid_tripoint ) {
4154 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4155 }
4156 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4157 break;
4158 }
4159 }
4160
4161 // couldn't find any places to go, so go somewhere.
4162 if( goal == overmap::invalid_tripoint || omt_path.empty() ) {
4163 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4164 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4165 // try one more time
4166 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4167 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4168 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4169 }
4170 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4171 goal = no_goal_point;
4172 }
4173 return;
4174 }
4175
4176 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "npc::set_omt_destination - new goal for NPC [" << get_name()
4177 << "] with [" << get_need_str_id( needs.front() )
4178 << "] is [" << dest_type << "] in " << goal.to_string() << ".";
4179}

1702 if( !tmpit.is_null() && total_space >= tmpit.volume() ) {
1703 tmpit.set_owner( *this );
1704 ret.push_back( tmpit );
1705 shop_value -= tmpit.price( true );
1706 total_space -= tmpit.volume();

1708 last_item = count > 10 && one_in( 100 );

808
809 const skill_id best = best_skill();
810
811 // if NPC has no suitable skills default to stabbing weapon
812 if( !best || best == skill_stabbing ) {
813 weapon = random_item_from( type, "stabbing", item_group_id( "survivor_stabbing" ) );
814 } else if( best == skill_bashing ) {
815 weapon = random_item_from( type, "bashing", item_group_id( "survivor_bashing" ) );
816 } else if( best == skill_cutting ) {

◆ stow_item()

void npc::stow_item ( item &  it)

Definition at line 1109 of file npc.cpp.

1110{
1111 if( wear_item( weapon, false ) ) {
1112 // Wearing the item was successful, remove weapon and post message.
1113 if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
1114 add_msg_if_npc( m_info, _( "<npcname> wears the %s." ), weapon.tname() );
1115 }
1116 remove_weapon();
1117 moves -= 15;
1118 // Weapon cannot be worn or wearing was not successful. Store it in inventory if possible,
1119 // otherwise drop it.
1120 return;
1121 }
1122 for( auto &e : worn ) {
1123 if( e.can_holster( it ) ) {
1124 if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
1125 //~ %1$s: weapon name, %2$s: holster name
1126 add_msg_if_npc( m_info, _( "<npcname> puts away the %1$s in the %2$s." ),
1127 weapon.tname(), e.tname() );
1128 }
1129 auto ptr = dynamic_cast<const holster_actor *>( e.type->get_use( "holster" )->get_actor_ptr() );
1130 ptr->store( *this, e, it );
1131 return;
1132 }
1133 }
1134 if( volume_carried() + weapon.volume() <= volume_capacity() ) {
1135 if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
1136 add_msg_if_npc( m_info, _( "<npcname> puts away the %s." ), weapon.tname() );
1137 }
1138 i_add( remove_weapon() );
1139 moves -= 15;
1140 } else { // No room for weapon, so we drop it
1141 if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
1142 add_msg_if_npc( m_info, _( "<npcname> drops the %s." ), weapon.tname() );
1143 }
1144 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), remove_weapon() );
1145 }
1146}

◆ talk_to_u()

void npc::talk_to_u ( bool  radio_contact = false)

Definition at line 730 of file npctalk.cpp.

731{
732 if( g->u.is_dead_state() ) {
733 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
734 return;
735 }
736 const bool has_mind_control = g->u.has_trait( trait_DEBUG_MIND_CONTROL );
737 // This is necessary so that we don't bug the player over and over
738 if( get_attitude() == NPCATT_TALK ) {
739 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
740 } else if( !has_mind_control && ( get_attitude() == NPCATT_FLEE ||
741 get_attitude() == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ) ) {
742 add_msg( _( "%s is fleeing from you!" ), name );
743 return;
744 } else if( !has_mind_control && get_attitude() == NPCATT_KILL ) {
745 add_msg( _( "%s is hostile!" ), name );
746 return;
747 }
748 if( get_faction() ) {
749 get_faction()->known_by_u = true;
750 }
751 set_known_to_u( true );
752 dialogue d;
753 d.alpha = &g->u;
754 d.beta = this;
755
756 chatbin.check_missions();
757
758 // For each active mission we have, let the mission know we talked to this NPC.
759 for( auto &mission : g->u.get_active_missions() ) {
760 mission->on_talk_with_npc( this->getID() );
761 }
762
763 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions_assigned ) {
764 if( mission->get_assigned_player_id() == g->u.getID() ) {
765 d.missions_assigned.push_back( mission );
766 }
767 }
768 d.add_topic( chatbin.first_topic );
769 if( radio_contact ) {
770 d.add_topic( "TALK_RADIO" );
771 d.by_radio = true;
772 } else if( is_leader() ) {
773 d.add_topic( "TALK_LEADER" );
774 } else if( is_player_ally() && ( is_walking_with() || has_activity() ) ) {
775 d.add_topic( "TALK_FRIEND" );
776 } else if( get_attitude() == NPCATT_RECOVER_GOODS ) {
777 d.add_topic( "TALK_STOLE_ITEM" );
778 }
779 g->u.dialogue_by_radio = d.by_radio;
780 int most_difficult_mission = 0;
781 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions ) {
782 const auto &type = mission->get_type();
783 if( type.urgent && type.difficulty > most_difficult_mission ) {
784 d.add_topic( "TALK_MISSION_DESCRIBE_URGENT" );
785 chatbin.mission_selected = mission;
786 most_difficult_mission = type.difficulty;
787 }
788 }
789 most_difficult_mission = 0;
790 bool chosen_urgent = false;
791 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions_assigned ) {
792 if( mission->get_assigned_player_id() != g->u.getID() ) {
793 // Not assigned to the player that is currently talking to the npc
794 continue;
795 }
796 const auto &type = mission->get_type();
797 if( ( type.urgent && !chosen_urgent ) || ( type.difficulty > most_difficult_mission &&
798 ( type.urgent || !chosen_urgent ) ) ) {
799 chosen_urgent = type.urgent;
800 d.add_topic( "TALK_MISSION_INQUIRE" );
801 chatbin.mission_selected = mission;
802 most_difficult_mission = type.difficulty;
803 }
804 }
805
806 // Needs
807 if( has_effect( effect_npc_suspend ) ) {
808 d.add_topic( "TALK_REBOOT" );
809 }
810 if( has_effect( effect_sleep ) || has_effect( effect_lying_down ) ) {
811 if( has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
812 d.add_topic( "TALK_SEDATED" );
813 } else {
814 d.add_topic( "TALK_WAKE_UP" );
815 }
816 }
817
818 if( d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_NONE" ) {
819 d.topic_stack.back() = talk_topic( pick_talk_topic( g->u ) );
820 }
821
822 moves -= 100;
823
824 if( g->u.is_deaf() ) {
825 if( d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_MUG" ||
826 d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_STRANGER_AGGRESSIVE" ) {
827 make_angry();
828 d.add_topic( "TALK_DEAF_ANGRY" );
829 } else {
830 d.add_topic( "TALK_DEAF" );
831 }
832 }
833
834 if( g->u.has_trait( trait_PROF_FOODP ) && !( g->u.is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask" ) ) ||
835 g->u.is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask_on" ) ) ) ) {
836 d.add_topic( "TALK_NOFACE" );
837 }
838
839 if( has_trait( trait_PROF_FOODP ) && !( is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask" ) ) ||
840 is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask_on" ) ) ) ) {
841 d.add_topic( "TALK_NPC_NOFACE" );
842 }
843
844 decide_needs();
845
846 dialogue_window d_win;
847 // Main dialogue loop
848 do {
849 if( chatbin.mission_selected != nullptr ) {
850 if( chatbin.mission_selected->get_assigned_player_id() != g->u.getID() ) {
851 // Don't talk about a mission that is assigned to someone else.
852 chatbin.mission_selected = nullptr;
853 }
854 }
855 if( chatbin.mission_selected == nullptr ) {
856 // if possible, select a mission to talk about
857 if( !chatbin.missions.empty() ) {
858 chatbin.mission_selected = chatbin.missions.front();
859 } else if( !d.missions_assigned.empty() ) {
860 chatbin.mission_selected = d.missions_assigned.front();
861 }
862 }
863 const talk_topic next = d.opt( d_win, name, d.topic_stack.back() );
864 if( next.id == "TALK_NONE" ) {
865 int cat = topic_category( d.topic_stack.back() );
866 do {
867 d.topic_stack.pop_back();
868 } while( cat != -1 && topic_category( d.topic_stack.back() ) == cat );
869 }
870 if( next.id == "TALK_DONE" || d.topic_stack.empty() ) {
871 d.beta->say( _( "Bye." ) );
872 d.done = true;
873 } else if( next.id != "TALK_NONE" ) {
874 d.add_topic( next );
875 }
876 } while( !d.done );
877
878 if( g->u.activity.id() == ACT_AIM && !g->u.has_weapon() ) {
879 g->u.cancel_activity();
880 // don't query certain activities that are started from dialogue
881 } else if( g->u.activity.id() == ACT_TRAIN ||
882 g->u.activity.id() == ACT_WAIT_NPC ||
883 g->u.activity.id() == ACT_SOCIALIZE ||
884 g->u.activity.index == getID().get_value() ) {
885 return;
886 }
887
888 if( !g->u.has_effect( effect_under_op ) ) {
889 g->cancel_activity_or_ignore_query( distraction_type::talked_to,
890 string_format( _( "%s talked to you." ), name ) );
891 }
892}

int npc::time_to_read ( const item &  book,

Definition at line 875 of file npc.cpp.

876{
877 const auto &type = book.type->book;
878 const skill_id &skill = type->skill;
879 // The reader's reading speed has an effect only if they're trying to understand the book as they read it
880 // Reading speed is assumed to be how well you learn from books (as opposed to hands-on experience)
881 const bool try_understand = reader.fun_to_read( book ) ||
882 reader.get_skill_level( skill ) < type->level;
883 int reading_speed = try_understand ? std::max( reader.read_speed(), read_speed() ) : read_speed();
884
885 int retval = type->time * reading_speed;
886 retval *= std::min( fine_detail_vision_mod(), reader.fine_detail_vision_mod() );
887
888 if( type->intel > reader.get_int() && !reader.has_trait( trait_PROF_DICEMASTER ) ) {
889 retval += type->time * ( type->intel - reader.get_int() ) * 100;
890 }
891 return retval;
892}

◆ update_path()

bool npc::update_path ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  no_bashing = false,
bool  force = true 
)

Tries to find path to p.

If it can, updates path to it.

Parameters
pDestination of pathing
no_bashingDon't allow pathing through tiles that require bashing.
forceIf there is no valid path, empty the current path.
Returns
If it updated the path.

2157{
2158 if( p == pos() ) {
2159 path.clear();
2160 return true;
2161 }
2162

2164 path.erase( path.begin() );

2170 // Our path already leads to that point, no need to recalculate
2171 return true;
2172 }
2173 }

2176 get_path_avoid() );

◆ value() [2/2]

int npc::value ( const item &  it,

Definition at line 1741 of file npc.cpp.

1742{
1743 if( it.is_dangerous() || ( it.has_flag( "BOMB" ) && it.active ) || it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
1744 // NPCs won't be interested in buying active explosives or spilled liquids
1745 return -1000;
1746 }
1747
1748 // faction currency trades at market price
1749 if( my_fac && my_fac->currency == it.typeId() ) {
1750 return market_price;
1751 }
1752
1753 int ret = 0;
1754 // TODO: Cache own weapon value (it can be a bit expensive to compute 50 times/turn)
1755 double weapon_val = weapon_value( it ) - weapon_value( weapon );
1756 if( weapon_val > 0 ) {
1757 ret += weapon_val;
1758 }
1759
1760 if( it.is_food() ) {
1761 int comestval = 0;
1762 if( nutrition_for( it ) > 0 || it.get_comestible()->quench > 0 ) {
1763 comestval++;
1764 }
1765 if( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() > 500 ) {
1766 comestval += ( nutrition_for( it ) +
1767 ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() - 500 ) / 10 ) / 6;
1768 }
1769 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty ) {
1770 comestval += ( it.get_comestible()->quench + get_thirst() - thirst_levels::thirsty ) / 4;
1771 }
1772 if( comestval > 0 && will_eat( it ).success() ) {
1773 ret += comestval;
1774 }
1775 }
1776
1777 if( it.is_ammo() ) {
1778 if( weapon.is_gun() && weapon.ammo_types().count( it.ammo_type() ) ) {
1779 // TODO: magazines - don't count ammo as usable if the weapon isn't.
1780 ret += 14;
1781 }
1782
1783 if( has_gun_for_ammo( it.ammo_type() ) ) {
1784 // TODO: consider making this cumulative (once was)
1785 ret += 14;
1786 }
1787 }
1788
1789 if( it.is_book() ) {
1790 auto &book = *it.type->book;
1791 ret += book.fun;
1792 if( book.skill && get_skill_level( book.skill ) < book.level &&
1793 get_skill_level( book.skill ) >= book.req ) {
1794 ret += book.level * 3;
1795 }
1796 }
1797
1798 // Practical item value is more important than price
1799 ret *= 50;
1800
1801 // TODO: Sometimes we want more than one tool? Also we don't want EVERY tool.
1802 if( it.is_tool() && !has_amount( it.typeId(), 1 ) ) {
1803 ret += market_price * 0.2; // 20% premium for fresh tools
1804 }
1805 ret += market_price;
1806 return ret;
1807}

float npc::vehicle_danger ( int  radius) const

1371{
1372 const tripoint from( posx() - radius, posy() - radius, posz() );
1373 const tripoint to( posx() + radius, posy() + radius, posz() );

1375
1376 int danger = 0;
1377

1380 const wrapped_vehicle &wrapped_veh = vehicles[i];
1381 if( wrapped_veh.v->is_moving() ) {
1382 // FIXME: this can't be the right way to do this
1383 units::angle facing = wrapped_veh.v->face.dir();
1384
1385 point a( wrapped_veh.v->global_pos3().xy() );
1386 point b( static_cast<int>( a.x + units::cos( facing ) * radius ),
1387 static_cast<int>( a.y + units::sin( facing ) * radius ) );
1388
1389 // fake size
1390 /* This will almost certainly give the wrong size/location on customized
1391 * vehicles. This should just count frames instead. Or actually find the
1392 * size. */
1393 vehicle_part last_part;
1394 // vehicle_part_range is a forward only iterator, see comment in vpart_range.h
1395 for( const vpart_reference &vpr : wrapped_veh.v->get_all_parts() ) {
1396 last_part = vpr.part();
1397 }
1398 int size = std::max( last_part.mount.x, last_part.mount.y );
1399
1400 double normal = std::sqrt( static_cast<float>( ( b.x - a.x ) * ( b.x - a.x ) + ( b.y - a.y ) *
1401 ( b.y - a.y ) ) );
1402 int closest = static_cast<int>( std::abs( ( posx() - a.x ) * ( b.y - a.y ) - ( posy() - a.y ) *
1403 ( b.x - a.x ) ) / normal );
1404
1405 if( size > closest ) {
1406 danger = i;
1407 }
1408 }
1409 }
1410 return danger;
1411}

1050 reason = _( "This can't be worn." );
1051 return false;
1052 }
1053
1054 // Splints ignore limits, but only when being equipped on a broken part
1055 // TODO: Drop splints when healed

1057 for( int i = 0; i < num_hp_parts; i++ ) {
1058 hp_part hpp = static_cast<hp_part>( i );
1059 body_part bp = player::hp_to_bp( hpp );
1060 if( is_limb_broken( convert_bp( bp ) ) && !has_effect( effect_mending, bp ) &&
1061 it.covers( convert_bp( bp ).id() ) ) {
1062 reason = _( "Thanks, I'll wear that now." );
1063 return !!wear_item( it, false );
1064 }
1065 }
1066 }
1067

1073 // TODO: Hazmat/power armor makes this not work due to 1 boots/headgear limit

1076 reason = _( "Thanks, I'll wear that now." );
1077 return true;
1078 } else {
1079 reason = _( "I tried but couldn't wear it." );
1080 return false;
1081 }
1082 }
1083 // Otherwise, maybe we should take off one or more items and replace them

1086 if( !it.covers( bp ) ) {
1087 continue;
1088 }

1090 auto iter = std::find_if( worn.begin(), worn.end(), [bp]( const item & armor ) {
1091 return armor.covers( bp );
1092 } );
1093 if( iter != worn.end() && !( is_limb_broken( bp ) && iter->has_flag( "SPLINT" ) ) ) {
1094 took_off = takeoff( *iter );
1095 break;
1096 }
1097 }
1098
1099 if( !took_off || worn.size() >= size_before ) {
1100 // Shouldn't happen, but does
1101 reason = _( "I tried but couldn't wear it." );
1102 return false;
1103 }
1104 }
1105 reason = _( "Thanks, I'll wear that now." );
1106 return worn.empty() && wear_item( it, false );

overridevirtual

Removes currently wielded item (if any) and replaces it with the target item.

Parameters
targetreplacement item to wield or null item to remove existing weapon without replacing it
Returns
whether both removal and replacement were successful (they are performed atomically)

◆ wield_better_weapon()

bool npc::wield_better_weapon ( )

Definition at line 3381 of file npcmove.cpp.

3382{
3383 // TODO: Allow wielding weaker weapons against weaker targets
3384 bool can_use_gun = ( !is_player_ally() || rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) );
3385 bool use_silent = ( is_player_ally() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) );
3386 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3387
3388 // Check if there's something better to wield
3389 item *best = &weapon;
3390 double best_value = -100.0;
3391
3392 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
3393
3394 const auto compare_weapon =
3395 [this, &best, &best_value, ups_charges, can_use_gun, use_silent]( const item & it ) {
3396 bool allowed = can_use_gun && it.is_gun() && ( !use_silent || it.is_silent() );
3397 double val;
3398 if( !allowed ) {
3399 val = weapon_value( it, 0 );
3400 } else {
3401 int ammo_count = it.ammo_remaining();
3402 int ups_drain = it.get_gun_ups_drain();
3403 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
3404 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
3405 }
3406
3407 val = weapon_value( it, ammo_count );
3408 }
3409
3410 if( val > best_value ) {
3411 best = const_cast<item *>( &it );
3412 best_value = val;
3413 }
3414 };
3415
3416 compare_weapon( weapon );
3417 // To prevent changing to barely better stuff
3418 best_value *= std::max<float>( 1.0f, ai_cache.danger_assessment / 10.0f );
3419
3420 // Fists aren't checked below
3421 compare_weapon( null_item_reference() );
3422
3423 visit_items( [&compare_weapon, this]( item * node ) {
3424 // Only compare melee weapons, guns, or holstered items
3425 if( node->is_melee() || node->is_gun() ) {
3426 compare_weapon( *node );
3427 } else if( node->get_use( "holster" ) && !node->contents.empty() && node != &weapon ) {
3428 // TODO: special case for "wield from wielded holster"
3429 const item &holstered = node->get_contained();
3430 if( holstered.is_melee() || holstered.is_gun() ) {
3431 compare_weapon( holstered );
3432 }
3433 }
3434 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
3435 } );
3436
3437 // TODO: Reimplement switching to empty guns
3438 // Needs to check reload speed, RELOAD_ONE etc.
3439 // Until then, the NPCs should reload the guns as a last resort
3440
3441 if( best == &weapon ) {
3442 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielded %s is best at %.1f, not switching", best->type->get_id().str(),
3443 best_value );
3444 return false;
3445 }
3446
3447 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielding %s at value %.1f", best->type->get_id().str(), best_value );
3448
3449 wield( *best );
3450 return true;
3451}

2897 if( it.get_comestible_fun() < 0 || it.poison > 0 ) {
2898 return false;
2899 }
2900 }
2901
2902 return true;

2078 return true;
2079 }

2083 }

2111 }
2112
2113 return true;

2574{
2575 map &here = get_map();
2576 // are we already in a chair
2577 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", pos() ) ) {
2578 // just chill here
2579 move_pause();
2580 return;
2581 }
2582 // already know of a chair, go there
2583 if( chair_pos != tripoint_min ) {
2584 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", here.getlocal( chair_pos ) ) ) {
2585 update_path( here.getlocal( chair_pos ) );
2586 if( pos() == here.getlocal( chair_pos ) || path.empty() ) {
2587 move_pause();
2588 path.clear();
2589 } else {
2590 move_to_next();
2591 }
2592 wander_pos = tripoint_min;
2593 return;
2594 } else {
2595 chair_pos = tripoint_min;
2596 }
2597 } else {
2598 // find a chair
2599 if( !is_mounted() ) {
2600 for( const tripoint &elem : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 30 ) ) {
2601 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", elem ) && !g->critter_at( elem ) && could_move_onto( elem ) &&
2602 here.point_within_camp( here.getabs( elem ) ) ) {
2603 // this one will do
2604 chair_pos = here.getabs( elem );
2605 return;
2606 }
2607 }
2608 }
2609 }
2610 // we got here if there are no chairs available.
2611 // wander back to near the bulletin board of the camp.
2612 if( wander_pos != tripoint_min ) {
2613 update_path( here.getlocal( wander_pos ) );
2614 if( pos() == here.getlocal( wander_pos ) || path.empty() ) {
2615 move_pause();
2616 path.clear();
2617 if( one_in( 30 ) ) {
2618 wander_pos = tripoint_min;
2619 }
2620 } else {
2621 move_to_next();
2622 }
2623 return;
2624 }

2626 cata::optional<basecamp *> bcp = overmap_buffer.find_camp( ( *assigned_camp ).xy() );
2627 if( !bcp ) {
2628 assigned_camp = cata::nullopt;
2629 move_pause();
2630 return;
2631 }
2632 basecamp *temp_camp = *bcp;
2633 std::vector<tripoint> pts;
2634 for( const tripoint &elem : here.points_in_radius( here.getlocal( temp_camp->get_bb_pos() ),
2635 10 ) ) {
2636 if( g->critter_at( elem ) || !could_move_onto( elem ) || here.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, elem ) ||
2637 !here.has_floor( elem ) || g->is_dangerous_tile( elem ) ) {
2638 continue;
2639 }
2640 pts.push_back( elem );
2641 }
2642 if( !pts.empty() ) {
2643 wander_pos = here.getabs( random_entry( pts ) );

◆ submap_coords

point npc::submap_coords
private

Global submap coordinates of the submap containing the npc.

Use global_*_location to get the global position. You should not change submap_coords directly, use pos instead, shift will update submap_coords and move the npc to a different overmap if needed. submap_coords defines the overmap the npc is stored on.

Definition at line 1269 of file npc.h.

Referenced by global_square_location(), npc(), place_on_map(), setpos(), spawn_at_precise(), and travel_overmap().
